Reviews.Title: Doesn't get much better than this for a Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: I.Peters
Reviews.Content: The Lumix DMC-ZS9 is my 7th digital point & shoot and my third Panasonic ( I also own a Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 (Violet), and a Panasonic Lumix DMC-S1 (Black)). After playing with it for a while, these are my thoughts:PROS- Features:I got this camera as a lightning deal here on Amazon and was very pleasantly surprised what all it offers for the price (even when one buys it at regular price it is still impressive). There is the Leica lens, for starters. Cheaper Panasonic cameras usually do not have Leica lenses so I am very happy. Moreover, the wide-angle is 24 mm - very nice as well. Add to that the 16x optical zoom, the Power image stabilization and the ability to shoot with Aperture priority, Shutter priority, Manual, Program and Panasonic's own iA mode (Intelligent Auto mode) and a variety of more or less useful Scene modes, the HD video capability, and many other features such as Macro and Macro Zoom mode, and one really gets a full-featured, very compact camera with a quality lens for a very good price.- Custom Modes:I like that this camera allows me to assign two of my preferred Scene modes to positions on the dial on top of the ZS9. My DMC-FH20 also has scene modes but I cannot assign them to any buttons, etc. This is definitely progress and appreciated. I tend to mostly photograph landscapes and pets, so my MS1 (stands for My Scene Mode 1) is set to Landscape mode, MS2 to Pet mode. In addition to that, the camera allows the photographer to define custom settings with all sorts of combinations to satisfy users who want more than just take pictures with the pre-programmed scene modes.- Scene Modes:These include almost every scene imaginable - from Portrait / Portrait Soft Skin to Food, Party, Candlelight, Landscape, Sports etc. and gimmicks such as Transform which elongates or widens motifs/subjects. There is a scene mode there for everyone, I'm sure of it...- Auto Focus:Very fast and accurate. I have not had any trouble to get it to lock, even in low-light, low-contrast situations. This is something I really value in a point & shoot because few things are more frustrating than not being able to get the camera to focus on the motif.- Easy Operation:As mentioned above, this is my third Panasonic Lumix, so I am rather familiar with the operation of their cameras. But I think that anyone would find operating this camera rather straightforward, unless the person is a total beginner or has not had much if any experience with digital cameras. Sure, there are always instances where one would have to consult the manual, but every-day point & shoot operation should not require too much thumbing through that. Note that the hard-copy manual that comes in the box only explains the very basics. The complete user manual comes in PDF format on the CD that is in the box.CONs (if one wants to call it that)- As with all cameras in this price range/class, I found that image noise and general image quality is very dependent on the zoom setting, even at lower ISO settings such as ISO100. While the camera shoots very well at short focal lengths and low ISO settings, it sometimes does not so well at long (digital) focal lengths. This is not too much of an issue when printing regular 4 x 6 or 5 x 7 prints but enlarging an image that was taken at full zoom will likely be problematic. Even with the Leica lens, I do not see a noticeable improvement in image quality when comparing it to my simpler and older DMC-FH20. While disappointing, this is also to be expected, and image noise is a sensor issue anyway. There is probably not a camera in this class out there that does not have the same problem. I am only mentioning this to be comprehensive.- Weight & Size. Don't get me wrong - the ZS9 is a small and lightweight camera but it still is bigger and heavier than for example the FH20. It is clear to me that it would have to be a bit heavier and bigger, considering the many more features the ZS9 has in comparison to the FH20. I am mentioning this only in case weight and size is the top priority for a reader. This camera is definitely not shirt-pocket material and I am not sure I'd be too comfortable carrying it in my jeans pocket either. Jacket pockets should generally be OK though ;-).- The color/surface. Call me nit-picky, but I LOVED the brushed metal surface of my FH20 as well as the fact that it came in several colors (my choice was violet at the time). While the ZS9 looks like it is made of high quality materials, I miss the classy brushed metal look and would have preferred almost any other color over the black. But in the end this is really strictly personal preference.SUMMARYI am very happy with this camera. I believe it is the ideal device for my primary purpose, which is using it as a compact travel camera. As a matter of fact, the ZS8 (the almost identical twin to the ZS9) is called TZ18 in Europe, TZ standing for Travel Zoom. This best describes the area where this camera shines. It isn't an SLR and will not produce SLR quality images but for the money, convenience and the quality it provides in its class, I'd be hard pressed to find a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Great photos and so easy to use
Reviews.Author: lrquade
Reviews.Content: I wanted a digital camera that I didn't have to mess with all the settings to take a picture. The reviews kept saying how easy this camera was to use so I bought it. I took it on vacation without even reading through the manual and it was so easy to use. My pictures came out so beautiful that I surprised myself. Everyone commented what an amazing photographer I was which made me laugh because all I did was leave it on the "intelligent mode" which basically lets the camera decide what setting it thinks it should use. The zoom is amazing. After 3 different digital cameras I am finally happy with my choice. I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor low light performance
Reviews.Author: utahphil
Reviews.Content: Okay, first off I bought this during the lighting deal at $149.  I was concerned with everyone saying Amazon had made a mistake and that this was the ZS8. Well I just got it and it says it is the ZS9.  The manual (which is made for the ZS8 and ZS9) appears to suggest the sole difference between the two is that the ZS9 does stereo recording in video while the ZS8 only allowed for mono.  So, Amazon did not make a mistake.  ZS9 is written write on top of the camera.  Found it odd Panasonic's own web site did not mention the ZZ9.**Update 11/19/11.  Camera continues to work well.  I have never expected much from flashes on point and shoot cameras but this one seems to have less output than most.  If you plan on shooting with a lot of flash I am not sure this would be the best camera (though I try to never use the flash anyway).  I also learned that firmware on some of the Panasonic cameras (and I believe this one) prevent the use of third party less expensive batteries (ugh).  If you are like me and stock up on cheap extra batteries you may want to look into this as an issue.  The Panasonic battery runs about $33 bucks while one can usually find third party batteries around the $10 range.**Updated 11/26/11.  After having enough time with the camera I decided that the flaws, at least in my situation, made this a camera not suited for my use.  My house tends to be darker with a majority of the lighting coming from incandescent light.  The low light photo quality was just not very good.  Even when using the flash on auto the camera would sometimes set an ISO of 800 which I could not understand.  At ISO 800 the pictures have noticeable noise.  I would say that the low light quality even with flash would be best for facebook, etc.  I would be afraid to blow them up to anything maybe beyond a 4x6.  I also had an opportunity to review the video quality.  I had once tried a Canon 230 HX and that quality was simply great.  I did not see anywhere near that quality indoors - but perhaps it is a light issue once again.  If you are planning on mainly shooting in the outdoors I am sure this may be a great option.  However, if you are looking for a small camera that can be used in all lighting conditions a back sided CMOS camera may be a better option.  I am still trying to find that perfect fit between my old Canon ELPH and my Canon T1i SLR.  Still looking for something that fits right in the middle.

Reviews.Title: The picture quality is FANTASTIC!
Reviews.Author: D. Greenspan "Granny DJ"
Reviews.Content: Just received this camera a few days ago and have only had the opportunity to shoot pictures indoors. Most of the shots have been of my grandchildren and pets but I am amazed at the clarity of the pictures! This is not my first Panasonic Lumix point and shoot camera, it is actually my third! The others have taken fantastic pictures when we went on a Mediterranean cruise, clear, concise shots of butterflies and flowers when we were in the Caribbean, and we captured some very precious moments when our twin grandsons were born! In a well lit room the color and clarity is perfect. In a dimly lit room the colors are more muted unless you are taking a portrait shot.I absolutely love the zoom, which is the only reason why I purchased another Lumix! I enjoy my other small Lumix point and shoot but I wanted a more versatile camera!We are going on a cruise in January and I think that I am going to leave my digital SLR at home, along with all the $$$ lenses, and take this one along!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Easy to Use Camera For Low Price!
Reviews.Author: W. Roe
Reviews.Content: Ok, Not comparable to my SLR but for an inexpensive point and shoot I am very impressed! Amazon is currently at $130 with free shipping! I purchased it for my wife who needs something very easy and intuitive to operate and this more than fills the bill. Even she has been able to navigate the menu without opening the instructions, largly due to the integrated "Help" which is a scrolling line of text which explains each menu item you are viewing. However she likes the selection wheel Panasonic has on many of their cameras which can be used in addition to menu navigation. I don't think many other cameras of this type have that wheel. Intellegent Auto (iA) is great, automatically selecting the appropriate scene setting, and you can program modes and scenes you use often. There are a large number of auto scene modes to chose from. 16x zoom (21x "intelligent zoom") is really versatile and the optical image stabilization allows the user to obtain good results at the maximum zoom setting. I have read reviews which state that this camera has a better sensor for low light situations than the much more expensive ZS10 which has GPS and a few more features I knew my wife would never utilize. Also this camera has much better battery life which is important to her. We are perfectly happy with the results from the video also and like that the zoom functions when shooting video. My only complaint so far (hardly worth mentioning)is that the symbols on the 4 way toggle to select flash, macro etc. are etched and not painted a different color so can be difficult to read for someone like my wife who is somewhat admittedly techncally challenged and likes things easy to read. I feel this is a great value and more than meets our expectations.

Reviews.Title: Another Panasonic Camera Winner!
Reviews.Author: Oceanhut
Reviews.Content: After almost three and a half years of use, I decided it was time to upgrade and purchase a new Panasonic Lumix camera. The only difference that I could find between the Panasonic Lumix ZS9 and the higher priced ZS10 was that the ZS10 has a GPS, which I didn't feel I needed. So, after reading the many reviews for this particular Panasonic model, I ordered it, and two days later I was on my way to Times Square and Rockerfeller Center with my new camera, to enjoy the sights and sounds of this holiday season. Without having time to throughly review the detailed instructions, I put the camera into "Intelligent Mode" (and using the "Zoom"), I started clicking away! WOW! The pictures are bright, clear, and the colors are incredible. Using the same "mode", the pictures I took at night of the various lighted billboards in Times Square are fantastic. The battery life is exceptional, and lasted through four days of day and night photos. I played around with the various camera features, and discovered that in the "playback mode", the still photos can be turned into videos, with music, while in the disc inside the camera! Amazing!  Also noted was the ability to add decorative frames to the photos. I am not professional photographer, or even a camera buff,  but instead a retired grandmother who loves taking family and vacation photos.The price that Amazon is now selling this camera for, with all the features that it offers, is unbelievable! A few days after I purchased this camera from Amazon, the price went down and I received a credit for the difference.  Yesterday, the price was cut again for the holidays, and again Amazon issued me a credit because it was within two weeks of my orginal purchase. The price, the features of this Panasonic DMC-ZS9, and Amazon's Customer Service, makes this an unbeatable value.Panasonic DMC-ZS9 14.1MP  Digital Camera with 16x Optical Zoom and 21x Intelligent Zoom Function (Black)

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Andrea Ramos
Reviews.Content: I bought the zs-1 a couple years ago and loved it so when i got a scratch on lense and had to replace it the Panasonic lumix was the only one I would consider. I love this one it has more features and greater zoom than my old one, also uses the same battery so now i have two back-ups as I had one for the other camera.

Reviews.Title: Cnet Says Buy It
Reviews.Author: Jim Smiley "JimnDot"
Reviews.Content: I've just ordered this on a $149 lightning deal, so I'll update after I've had a chance to run it through the mill. It is a Panasonic DMZ-ZS8 exclusive for Amazon. Thus the 9 in place of the 8. CNet gives a great review of the camera, and I've found their opinion pretty accurate. For those hoping to get more camera for less on Black Friday may be left out in the cold. If you need a no-brainer travel camera I can't imagine anything with these features for less money for awhile yet. Update: Now that I've had a few days to play with this I'm keeping my 5 Star rating. I replaced a Nikon S-8000 that I paid double for and sold a month later because of the annoying pop up flash. The DMZ-ZS9 beats the Nikon in every way! The flash is internal. The optical zoom is better, in fact it's as close to an SLR as I've ever seen in a point and shoot. Plus it has the same number of pixels. The Panasonic is also much more user friendly. I'm not a photography geek so I need something easy to operate and understand. This camera is all that and more.

Reviews.Title: My latest Leica lens Panasonic camera is a winner and low priced
Reviews.Author: Ellie "Eilean Siar"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS9 is ready for action. My first Panasonic Lumix from nearly six years ago with 5MP surprised me with the quality of its lens and build. This one is my fourth Panasonic/Leica P&S; camera and none of them has let me down. I also have a Panasonic dedicated video camera which takes 1080P (6ofps), so I know the video quality of a good consumer video recorder.Brief testing has shown this to have excellent video at 720P in good light (the video file size is limited to 2GB per scene). If you don't know the lighting requirements to get good video and still images indoors then don't complain about poor video or stills in the dimly-lit rec room. The lens in this camera has nearly an F/4 lens which is not very fast. A decent HD dedicated video camera would have a lens of F/2 or faster (lets in four times as much light). Also, a video camera would have a total image chip size much larger. The image chip on this camera is less than 1/2 inch in size. This is much smaller than a good quality SLR imaging chip. Quality SLRs are capable of higher quality results because they have more costly lenses, frames, electronics, and imaging chips. For all the previous reviewers who complained that this one hundred and thirty dollar camera was not giving them the results they "expected" I have a word for you: #FAIL!All point and shoot cameras have imaging chips which are about half an inch in size like this one has. And, considering, they take remarkably good photos within their limitations. Unless you are a professional photographer, you might never need any more quality than a good P&S; camera provides. It takes very good stills with long telephoto possible. At this point I should tell you about the button to the right of the shutter/zoom button - it is a dedicated button which caused the zoom to cycle through three ranges with no intermediate stops: 1) zoom to end of optical range, 2) zoom to end of extended optical range, 3) zoom to end of the digital zoom range. Talk about not wasting time if you have some serious rush to zoom way out! And the focus is fast but, of course, you should not just jam the shutter down, but rather press it halfway to focus, then press it the rest of the way to take the picture. Press the shutter at the end of a power zoom to focus better if necessary. It is fast!One thing that I think is extraordinary is that the fastest shutter speed is 1/4000 of a second. I have never heard of an inexpensive P&S; camera with a speed of more than 1/1000 or at most 1/2000 sec shutter speed. Such a high shutter speed being available allows some specialised photography that formerly only an SLR could do. In the menus many selections are available to customise photos and video settings.The camera requires a Panasonic-approved battery so no cheap knock-offs can be used with this. An important and unusual feature in a camera in this price range is that you can use the camera in a fixed setting, eg studio, using a Panasonic DC coupler (which fits into the battery compartment) and a Panasonic AC adapter which plugs into the DC coupler through a little hatch in the bottom of the camera. These are both extra cost Panasonic accessories which give a professional ability to do unlimited shooting without worrying about running out of battery power. Just think! you could run your own photographic studio using such a setup and this little, yet very capable, camera.It arrives with a CD containing a very thorough PDF about the camera. Don't skip this because it is much more valuable than the PDF you can download on the Panasonic website which shows relatively basic information but not the all important details. Another bit of software on the installation CD (which one does not need to use because Windows 7 or Apple OS will handle importing and sorting photos) is Photo Fun 6.0 which, in my opinion might only be worthwhile for stitching photos into a panorama or doing simple edits on video. Google's Picassa photo software, Flickr editing software, Windows Live Photo software, YouTube video editing online, and Apple's iPhoto will likely do as good a job or likely a better job at organising and processing your photos and video.Ergonomics are quite good and it holds and handles well. Feels well-made but heavy (you want that - plastic is light but not as durable, for example) with metal construction. This is a camera you can be proud of. And it may just last long enough to pass down to your children someday, unlike many low priced cameras which fail within a few years. I suggest installing the wrist strap and always use it. Drops kill cameras, even one made as well as this.Lastly, and importantly, it is MADE IN JAPAN!

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera!
Reviews.Author: Gio
Reviews.Content: First of all I'm not a camera geek so I'm not the one to ask opinion over some cameras, but this one performs very well.What I like is that:1. It starts up as soon as you switch on (so no boot up speed, you won't be missing any good moments anymore)2. It's quite light and handy to use3. It has absolutely stunning photo quality, for a point and shoot camera.4. Has many features to experiment, customize your device.I haven't been able to test it out really well so I haven't found anything to complain about. Oh the built in memory is really little, you can take only 13 pictures with 14MP. Other than that it's a perfect camera for the price. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Very good quality and conveniently small
Reviews.Author: Lara
Reviews.Content: A really nice camera, and conveniently small in size. The pictures are amazing, you can use "auto" for most things, but perhaps you will want to take the time to figure out what setting is best for a given scene (portrait, night-time, landscape and such). I found that "auto" might not be the best choice in the evenings (put it to "night landscape" and the picture will be amazing). Test different scenes before a trip, so you're not trying to figure settings out when you are sightseeing. One thing that bothered me is that with "auto" setting, the a bright clear sky with the scenic background pretty much disappeared and only the foreground looked good (give "auto" a miss and use "daytime landscape"). Take a few minutes to play with the camera and then it will reward you with excellent pictures! I'm satisfied, thoroughly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Mailloux "tom-m"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this little camera for about a month now and love it.The wide-to-telefoto zoom is the most versatile lens I've ever used. It backs up to fit in an entire room, and brings distant objects up close. The sharpness is exceptional for a zoom lens.The controls are simple and you can start shooting right out of the box. (I assume you bought a memory card, right?) The control to flip between shoot mode and viewing shots is handy and not something you'd hit by accident. the zoom control is right under the shutter. The viewscreen is large and bright.The camera is small and light. I've carried it in my shirt pocket. I find this encourages me to take it along when I move around, and take more pics as a result.This is not a DSLR and can't do some of the things a DSLR can, but at this price and size you should not expect that.This is a solid camera with a solid lens and electronics and a solid bargain.

Reviews.Title: Love this more than my SLR
Reviews.Author: Lewis De Payne "Lew Payne"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at the end of 2011, as a present to myself.  I also purchased an 8GB Class 10 SDHC card by Transcend for $10, along with a cheap but adequate case for $7.95 or so (all through Amazon).  Over the past decade, I've owned several point-n-shoot cameras (including two prior Lumix).  I also own a full-blown Olympus digital SLR with interchangeable lenses.  I must say... this (DMC-ZS9) is the best Lumix yet, and so very affordable!I am now carrying this camera in the glove box of my car, so I can take those pictures I've always wanted to, but didn't have my SLR handy.  The camera has enough automation to make picture taking quick and painless, while still allowing full manual override for those times when I want to compose something special (without needing my SLR!).The anti-shake works well, especially when using the telephoto mode to capture far away shots.  In fact, the zoom is amazing on this little wonder... and while I don't care much for digital zoom (or the inherent artifacts), the true optical zoom is great... and the digital boost is very handy when I need incredible close-ups of distant objects.The intelligent auto-everything mode works really well, even in outdoor conditions.  The quick keys help me turn the flash completely off when I want to, without having to dig through the main menu system to do so.  This camera, on a tripod, can take amazing low-light shots indoors.  With flash, shots are flat and faces shiny (due to the oils in a face that hasn't been prepped by a makeup artist) - as expected. Turn off that flash, set the self timer, and take a picture that way - incredible!As expected, low light level performance is dismal (the aperture is pretty small - after all, this is a compact camera with lots of zoom).  But, with some natural bounce light from windows and room lighting, some incredible pictures can be had by turning the flash off and using the auto-timer to avoid shaking the camera when pressing the shutter button.  Buy a cheap tripod (or monopod if you don't plan on being in the pictures)... it's be well worth it.Battery life on this camera is excellent... several hundred pictures, and by not using flash, you extend its life even further.  An 8GB SDHC card can hold approximately 1,400 pictures or so... easily a week's vacation, unless you simply don't know how to frame and take pictures correctly.  Oh, speaking of that, this camera even features the classic auto-bracketing; when activated, it will take three pictures for every one click of the button, the first a little under-exposed, the next "normal" and the last over-exposed... so you can choose from the best of the three when dealing with tricky lighting conditions.Another thing I really like about this camera is the auto-focus... unlike previous compact cameras, it's FAST... even the "boot up" time is fast - you can turn the camera on and be shooting in under two seconds.  That used to be the bane of my existence - having to wait 6 to 10 seconds for my prior Lumix to boot, and several seconds for it to auto-focus.  Well, this one isn't like that - this one is a joy to own and operate!I've taken indoor pictures, as well as pictures of my snowshoeing trip.  All have been excellent (turned flash off for indoor pics), and color rendition has been quite good.  Of course, I use Picasa to adjust and fine-tune the fruits of my efforts prior to displaying them.  I'm considering selling my SLR, and just living with the ZS9... as there's simply no point in my owning an SLR anymore.  A good photographer can produce incredible images with any camera that can be manually controlled.  The ZS9, however, does a great job even when thinking for itself.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZS9  Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Margo
Reviews.Content: Just received my camera today and used it tonight at grand-daughters basketball game and really like the features....it will take time to learn all the wonderful things that can be done with it...I wanted a camera that gave me nice closeups...I purchased a memory card...charged battery for a short time and was ready to go...small easy to carry...very happy with it so far..The reviews online helped me make up my mind to order...and Amazon offered it at a special.

Reviews.Title: It is a ZS9 as Amazon says
Reviews.Author: J. Mageean
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Amazon.  It is a ZS9.  The box and the camera say that.  Those who are saying Amazon made a mistake must be stating an opinion not based on any first hand knowledge.  Those stating that it is just a ZS8 with stereo seem to be trying to imply that in some way this diminishes it value.  Almost every camera out there is in some way an upgrade from all the prior cameras.  By in large, most of the point and shoot name brand cameras are great.  The resolution is at a point where most picture takers don't need any more because it just takes up more memory which is rather cheap now.  I like the camera, it is fast has lots of features and takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: I absolutely LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: Kristina Halstead
Reviews.Content: I have needed a new camera for a long time, and was given this Panasonic DMC-ZS9 as a Christmas gift this year (2011).  When I unwrapped it, I thanked my husband for the camera and wasn't THAT impressed with the looks of it.  Once I finally started to take pictures I realized that they were very clear (and I find it incredibly hard to hold still lol).  I snapped photos of kids in motion and our new puppy (who was a blur in EVERY previous photo we had of her due to motion).  Every photo came out beautifully.  I am a novice astronomy buff, I love to look at the stars,moon,planets,etc.  I decided to take my camera out on a crystal clear night to see if I could get a decent picture of the moon.  Boy did I!!!  This camera took the most amazing photo of the moon I have ever seen.  I posted the photo online and everyone wanted to know how I got such a clear photo with my telescope!  I informed them, I only used my digital camera, and then of course everyone wanted to know what type of camera and how much.  I have friends with cameras that cost 4 times the cost of this little gem and their photos don't even look as good.  I would recommend this camera to anyone.  It is incredibly easy to use, and has a stabilizer function (you can set it to automatically stabilize) that works really well.  I know longer have streaked/blurred photos because someone decided to move at the last second before the camera snapped a photo.  Even my bad photos are better than the best photos ever taken with my old camera (which was a $500 camera by the way).

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZS9
Reviews.Author: M. Chen
Reviews.Content: I also got this camera from the Gold Box deal.  I own a DMC-ZS6 so I am very happy with the additional features on the ZS9.  My only gripe is that the ZS9 does not have a HDMI output, only component.  The ZS6 has a HDMI output, so it's really easy to just plug it into the side of my HDTV and start viewing pictures.  To connect the ZS6 via component, I have to reach to the back of the TV.

Reviews.Title: get the camera, but not the recommended case
Reviews.Author: ozca9
Reviews.Content: The ZS9 is a great camera, but don't buy the case, Case Logic TBC-302, that Amazon says that most people also purchase when buying the ZS9.  It's too small for the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: PNR Aficionado
Reviews.Content: Product arrived early & in perfect shape. I love the functions and ease of use. The zoom function and clarity are better than those of most other cameras in the same price-range.

Reviews.Title: Very Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Yogi Boo Boo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I am in commercial real estate and need a workhorse that is easy to use. I use the autofocus, and it takes great pictures both inside and out - very rarely do I need to do any adjusting to the photos. The camera is not the smallest - but I like the size and also the heft - it feels like a quality product. Again, it's easy to use, and I can't believe the battery life. Yesterday I took almost 275 pictures - zooming in and out, and generally leaving the camera on while walking between properties. The latter tends to be hard on a battery because your camera is constantly trying to focus while you are moving. But - it has a great sleep feature that kicks in so long after a picture has been taken. Anyway - after several hours and all of those pictures, I had only drained 1/3 of the battery. The long battery life means that I don't have to buy a couple of spares. Also, the charger is easy to use - pop the batttery in the charger and plug it directly into an outlet - no additional cord necessary. I would definitely recommend this camera, and might even pick up another one as a spare.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC ZS9
Reviews.Author: R. Lee "The Reader"
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Amazon for  $129.99 and it  the best camera I have ever owned and that includes units up into the $700. range.I recently went to the  Middle East and wanted something small and easy to carry. I wasn't looking for the best resolution but just something to get the sites with.This unit blows all the others away.First you can  use 120or 220-its automatic on the charger. The battery lasts FOREVER-never needed a second although I took one.The best part was the resolution- AMAZING!I have 8X10 that show every pore in my skin from 40 ft away. The optical zoom of  16X is more that  adequate to see a small bird from 200 ft with great details.The key is the Leica lens that is so underpriced I can't believe it . Also skin tones are top notch.A great camera to travel with-fits on your belt and is about the same size as a cigarette slim pack.BUY THIS CAMERA.PS  I do not work for Amazon or Panasonic but this is just such a superior product it should be rewarded.Don't waste money on interchangeable lens,separate flash units and bulky SLR-get this one.

Reviews.Title: panasonic DMC-ZS(
Reviews.Author: Mark J. Naniot
Reviews.Content: Two words, BUY IT!!!! I have had several point and shoot cameras for back up to my SLR and have been disapointed. my recent was a fuji fx70exr and it was terrible. The overall picture quality of the panasonic is great. As others have reviewed it lacks a little in low light but not bad at all. Video is great for a point and shoot, no noise from shutter or zoom and the ability to zoom in video mode is great. The 16 power zoom does amazingly well. Not something you want to enlarge a lot but it is fine. I have taken about a thousand pictures and am amazed at how good the quality is in a large variety of situations. If you are looking for a great point and shoot look no further. You won't be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable pocketable camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable pocketable camera. Purchased about 2 months ago. Great small, long zoom camera. It has nice features to tweak your photos. Being on duty in Afghanistan I am able to get great shots of the mountains with the zoom as well as aircraft in the sky. The colors are nicely saturated and can be enhanced with settings on the camera( a few photos a touch soft on edges). It has snappy shot to shot performance. Though, I suggest a class 6 or better yet a class 10 sdhc card to maximize its performance. Battery life is impressive. I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Best P and S out there!
Reviews.Author: Rick L. Stevens
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have been looking for a few weeks now for a good point and shoot camera. We tried a Cannon and a Kodak camera and weren't very impressed with either one so we returned both of them. The stills with both cameras were mediocre and video was terrible. So, a few nights ago I found this camera here on Amazon for only 129.00. I scoured the net looking at all the reviews and noticed that by far most of them were positive and focused on how the quality of the stills were and how awesome the HD video was.This camera has many reviews online. We took a gamble and bought one for each of us. WOW,,,are we ever impressed. The picture quality is great, especially at low ISO settings,eg.,100. The HD video quality blew us away. Even indoors I couldn't believe how clear it was. This is the first P and s camera I've seen where the video is this brilliant. Even better than the stills. I surely can't see how anyone could give this camera a low star review unless they don't know anything about how to use it. Buy it! You will not be disappointed. I noticed that they are selling pretty quickly. You best hurry and not miss this one.

Reviews.Title: My third camera in this series, and the best so far
Reviews.Author: Suz
Reviews.Content: I first saw one of these small Panasonic Lumix point-and-shoot digicams, on vacation in 2007. Our professional tour guide owned it, along with a larger "bridge" superzoom Panasonic camera. He took some fabulous photographs with those cameras. When I got home, I bought a Panasonic Lumix DMC-TZ3, which at the time had the widest lens of any consumer point and shoot digicam on the market. I really liked that camera, although I quickly learned one quirk of all these small Lumix cameras: the lens cover/mechanism is the most fragile part.Some P&S; cams can be dropped into a purse or bag without any case or cover, and do fine. Don't try it with one of these; I did, and broke the lens cover and therefore the entire mechanism that extends the lens when the camera is powered on, and retracts it fully when powered off. I was able to replace the TZ3, and by keeping it in a case when not in use, never had another lens problem.  A few years after the TZ3, I got more zoom, and more features, with the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS1. I took that camera almost everywhere I went, and was never disappointed with the pictures I took with it (save for some cases of operator error, not the camera's fault).  As with the TZ3, I've always kept the ZS1 in a case when it's not in use, and have never had a problem with the lens mechanism. A year or two ago I was tempted by a deep Costco discount to try the then-brand-new ZS10, which had a CMOS sensor and 16x optical zoom, plus a few other new bells and whistles. I ended up returning it because I didn't think its pictures were as good as the ones I was getting with my older ZS1 (with its CCD sensor).Last December I found this camera, the ZS9, on amazon at a terrific low price. I read reviews carefully and bought it, because it has a much longer zoom than my trusty old ZS1, but the same kind (CCD) of sensor that I've been happy with. I have not been disappointed with this upgrade to my trusty old ZS1, and have really enjoyed the increased zoom capability along with the good old standby wide-angle lens.

Reviews.Title: Best Point&Shoot; out there.
Reviews.Author: Gary K
Reviews.Content: I've read some of the other reviews here and I cannot imagine anyone not being happy with the performance of this camera.  Any negative feedback must be from people who got the very odd bad one, or they simply don't know how to take a picture.  This has amazing low light performance, even at distance.  Pictures from inside the Vatican on a recent trip are amazing. I see more detail in the pics than I remember seeing in person (though it helps that the camera is plugged into our 55" tv).  I'm not a fan of the flash, but it's rare that I find a situation that I need it, low light photos are that good.  If you're going to use ALL the zoom, you will need to steady the camera mechanically as most people cannot hold the camera that still, even with the stabilization feature, but that's only needed when maxing out the zoom and not for any other shots.  Just learn to use the features by reading the manual and you can't go wrong with the ZS9.  However, if you just want to point & shoot using 'intelligent auto', like my wife, then that works great, too. By the way, I've owned the Sony, and tried the Nikon equivalents, and I would choose this over those in nearly every situation.

Reviews.Title: Great P&S; image quality with CCD sensor
Reviews.Author: Mark Hammond
Reviews.Content: My impression is the older CCD sensors for point and shoot cameras deliver better, sharper image quality than the newer CMOS cameras (though CMOS is said to perform better in low light). Two examples are the Canon S100 and Lumix ZS10 -- both newer P&S; models with CMOS sensors, they have been subject of many complaints re poor image quality i.e. smeary, smudgy not crisp.Last year I bought a CMOS point and shoot camera -- a Canon Elph 300. The image quality was wretched both indoors and out, considerably worse than any CCD point and shoot I'd used before (Nikon and Canon). I started hunting for a CCD camera and settled on this gem, the Panasonic Lumix ZS9.I'm delighted with the ZS9 image quality. Vibrant, bright, realistic ... or if you like a little saturation, the Vivid and Warm modes and a white balance adjustment delivers in spades. In due time I'll acquire a micro 4/3 camera for (near) DSLR-caliber image quality, but for a P&S; camera the ZS9 is superb -- with 16x zoom that you won't find on a micro 4/3 without a ginormous lens.Also love the 24mm wide angle lens -- expands the field of vision beautifully. The camera is solid and well designed and the battery life is shockingly good. I bought mine for $114 "used" via Amazon Warehouse Deals and it was in mint shape, just like new -- fantastic value.My only complaint (more of an observation) is that on certain indoor shots, the lower left corner can be slightly darkened. Others have noted this phenomenon as well. To me it doesn't matter ... solved easily enough with a crop if needed.Final note: The only difference between this ZS9 and the ZS8 is that the ZS9 has a stereo microphone, the ZS8 has mono. If this ZS9 is sold out and you want this camera, check out the ZS8.[UPDATE: After three months and hundreds of photos, the ZS9 continues to wow me. The image quality is awesome for a point and shoot. Friends on Facebook ask me what camera I use, the photos get lots of compliments. The clarity and vividity is superb for a P&S; and the zoom is fantastic. Again, if the ZS9 is now longer available, check out the ZS8 with the same CCD sensor, missing only a stereo microphone).]

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Ejaz
Reviews.Content: I am a Canon person but when my brother, who is an absolute cameras and photography buff, told me about this camera and at this price, I couldn't resist to buy it. It turned out to be an absolute gem. Quite comparable to small Canons, one that I was looking for, with excellent optical zoom and photo quality. I do not use flash even indoors when there is enough ambient light and it gives me very clear and natural pictures, not dark as other pocket cameras do. I would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for a pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: You Won't Be Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Reel To Real
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I couldn't resist the deal even though I've been happily using a Panasonic Zs7, and I used a Zs3 before that. The Zs8/9 is 14 MP versus 12 MP for the Zs7. The Zs8/9 has a long 16x optical zoom versus 12x optical zoom for the Zs7. Both cameras are the same size. The Zs3 is also a 12X zoom and is a little smaller than the Z7 or 8/9. Both earlier Z's are a little heavier than the Z8/9. The Z8/9 is more user friendly than the previous models in that it explains through the LCD screen the difference between the various settings one can choose. The Zs8/9 has a sweet 24mm wide lens, which is wider than the 25mm wide lens on the Zs3 and Zs7.So what makes the Zs8/9 such a great value considering it doesn't have GPS,AVCHD video mode, and HDMI out, all of which come with the Zs7? Because I find the picture quality is just as good and possibly better. Maybe it's because of the newer Venus engine. The Zs8/9 has an upgraded Venus VI processing engine compared to the Venus II on the Zs7. Both cameras come with the same outstanding Leica lens and both have a 1/2.33 inch CCD sensor, which creates sharper pictures than the 1/2.33 inch CMOS sensor on the more expensive Zs10.The one area where the Zs7 shines compared to the Zs8/9 is the LCD screen with 460,000 dots versus 230,000 dots. Though I like the sharper LCD screen on the Zs7, I find the 230,000 dot Zs8/9 screen is more than adequate. I can also use the spare aftermarket battery I bought for my Zs7 with the Zs9. The relatively inexpensive aftermarket batteries available for this camera are actually longer lasting than the Panasonic battery that comes with it.The Zs8 and Zs9 differ only in that the Zs9 has a stereo microphone and the Zs8 is just monaural, otherwise the two cameras are the same. In summary, I don't care about GPS (a battery drain) or the ACVHD video format which came on the Zs7 and come on the Zs10 at a much higher price. If you've never owned a Panasonic Zs camera, you don't know how really good they are. The HD video quality on this camera is also amazing.I bought my Zs7 on Amazon for around $300, the going price at the time. Don't be afraid to order your Zs9 "Used" from Amazon Warehouse. That's how I bought mine. It's really not "used." You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Keydet '67
Reviews.Content: This camera is a fantastic buy.  For one who use to use a SLR but wanted something that fits into a pocket for travel this is it.  The zoom is great.  I would like a view finder vice the screen but I can learn to live with this.  The only drawback is the instruction book is a pdf file and when you are learning, it would be nice to have it available (without having to print)so you can refer to it.  That said, the camera is relatively easy to learn and once you get the hang of it, many options have short explanations on the screen that help.  I would definitely recommend this camera for novices and experts alike.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect
Reviews.Author: J. Lee Mize "IT pro"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera.  My last digicam was the Canon PowerShot SD780IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Black), and the ZS9 blows it away on several fronts; Notably, on image quality, features, price, speed, and construction.  I am really surprised that this camera is being sold for so low a price.  As such, I was slightly concerned about the purchase at first, despite all of the positive reviews, but after four days of intense use and manipulating all of the modes, scenes, and functions, I am convinced I made the correct choice.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: RICHARD
Reviews.Content: I have only taken a few photos and videos to date, but am very pleased with this camera.  It is compact enough for ease ofcarrying, has a nice bright viewscreen, intuitive menu, and solid build quality.  I love the 16x optical zoom in such a compactcamera body.  The sale price on Amazon was exceptionally good.  I read many reviews before this purchase, and although some werecritical, most were positive and many were written with knowledge and depth that are far more detailed than my review will be.Overall, I am happy with this purchase.  If you want a quality camera that will take good photos, has a usable 16x optical zoom,and can double as a 720p hi-def camcorder for an on the spot "video moment clip", this will do the job nicely.  Just make sure to use a minimum class 6 SD card for video...and preferably class 10.  I am using class6 cards and they handling video nicely.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware! Poor value; lacking customer care
Reviews.Author: ML
Reviews.Content: I am not going to go into an in-depth review as that has been done here at Amazon and at DPReview dot com.Settings/Menu navigation is average.  Focus and shutter response are pretty quick.  Strong feature set, esp. the 16x optical zoom, Leica lens (hopefully better than average), and good image stabilization inside a compact/pocket-size package.  But none of that matters since the image quality is very poor, displaying heavy noise (random-colored grain) when viewed at 100%.  I understand this is a compact camera and not a professional camera, but none of my other digital cameras (most consumer-grade) are this bad.  On the consumer cameras, I always shoot images at best Jpeg quality (least compression) and max resolution (or raw if it is available for certain situations).  So the image quality should not be due to higher compression.  Even in full daylight, or full fluorescent light (incl. w/ flash), or full incandescent (incl. w/ flash), and forcing the camera to ISO 100, it is still pretty bad, particularly in and around any kind of shadow and solid darker colors.  If you look at any kind of detail, the noise jumps out at you.  Panasonic engineers/designers/marketers should be ashamed for accepting this awful substandard image quality.I also have an older Panasonic DMC-FZ18 (18x optical zoom, image stabilization, and not compact) I gave to my spouse and it produces better quality images that are of acceptable quality (but far short of a good professional camera).  The DMC-FZ18's image quality suffers in high-ISO, low-light situations, to where it is intolerable but still a little better than this DMC-ZS9.I called Panasonic customer service and the rep I talked to seemed very knowledgeable on the Panasonic camera line and on advanced photography fundamentals.  He started to walk me through very basic troubleshooting steps, which I had already performed so I explained I have two decades of photography experience, we talked about photography fundamentals until he was convinced I knew what I was talking about.  We then skipped right to the settings I had set on the camera until he finally told me I need to send the camera in to their McAllen, TX, service center (with a note attached giving my case number and explaining my issue).  I sent the camera in and Panasonic turned it around pretty fast and got it back to me in just over two weeks (they also called me to notify me they received it and a technician was working on it), BUT they found no issues with the camera and declared it "CHECKED OK".  So Panasonic manufactured a very poor quality camera and refuses to acknowledge the image quality issue.The firmware and/or the CCD is garbage, which makes the camera itself pretty worthless.  Panasonic refuses to acknowledge the image quality issue and claims the camera is fine.  So I have a compact camera that is suitable only for publishing low-quality, low-resolution pictures, which is ultimately useless to most people.

Reviews.Title: Lumix was the way to go!
Reviews.Author: shesgoneforgood "John"
Reviews.Content: I don't know how many cameras I looked at before buying this but to make a long story short, dollar for dollar, this was the best for the money. It's been years since I used my Nikon 35mm for anything, not that it isn't a great camera, I'm just a really crummy photographer.  It didn't seem prudent to continue to pay for processing photo's to line my trash can with, so it was time to go digital. Put this thing in the full auto mode and you will get a very respectable photo from it. The zoom works great and the macro was perfect for detailed shots of electronics and circuit boards. Good display, easy navigation and so on. It does like batteries, especially when shooting HD video, but this is a excellent choice for a well built, nicely optioned, every day camera. Even for us crummy photographers.  If you like to experiment you have a great deal of control when shooting in the manual mode, I'll leave that to all you professionals out there.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic hits a home run (& then captures the image)!
Reviews.Author: DrCurtisScott
Reviews.Content: This unit replaced a Kodak 12 Mp unit.  The picture is MUCH better and it's NOT a result of 2 MP more resolution.  The electronics are FAST to respond and intelligent to the context of your images.  And the battery life is absolutely stunning!  My last camera ATE batteries.  This camera uses a Li-ion battery that keeps a charge for a LONG time between uses and then goes & goes!  Panasonic is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: keenneogeo
Reviews.Content: With the zoom, all the features and the picture quality in situations that could be considered poor for photography I am more than happy with this product! I got it as a birthday present and from that day forward it has taken great pictures no matter the lighting, movement or angle of my shot. Overall, I am very pleased with it and the quality of shots more than makes up for the battery-which has to be charged, but lasts a long time.

Reviews.Title: Not so great after all.
Reviews.Author: M. ANDERSON "DEAL FINDER"
Reviews.Content: OK, I've been loyal to Sony for the last time! 3 out of the last 3 Sony products I've owned have broken. The last straw was the Camera! Lately I've found that every Panasonic that I've owned has been top quality both in function and reliability! WOW this Panasonic DMC-ZS9 is the best Camera I've ever owned! Most impressive is the ZOOM! This Camera has an Ezoom button on top, touch it once for max optical zoom, touch it twice for max Optical/digital Zoom 44.3 times ZOOM! I took a picture of a water tower across a field about 8 miles away and when I reviewed the pic, I could almost read the writing on the tower, It's that good! What also is amazing is the camera's Burst mode! with a class 10 sd card, it takes about 5 pics per second! With this Camera you can take great pictures right out of the box, but take time to learn how the other features work because this camera is loaded with them! One more note about some of the complaints about the indoor picture quality, this camera is Average in this catagory. If you are not satisfied with the indoor quality of pictures, take a little time to learn the features, there are settings to adjust your exposure for dimly lit rooms, no Camera is going to take a good indoor/night shot more than 20 feet away unless you adjust your shutter speed.Update: 1/26/13 For some reason, this camera has gone downhill in picture quality, Almost every outdoor picture when taking a person with background scenery (Ocean, Lake, sunset, Etc.) the background gets washed out! I have not been able to make any adjustment to fix this, It's very frustrating! When you take a Picture of someone in front of say a Lake on a bright day, you get a nice picture of the person standing in front of a bright white background, very disappointing! I can no longer Recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZS9 Great Camera, Great Price
Reviews.Author: MGJ
Reviews.Content: We needed a camera that was easy to use, easy to carry, rechargeable batteries, good quality pictures, good video recording capability and affordable. The Panasonic DMC-ZS9 met and exceeded all of our expectations. We love this camera, and look forward to many years of use and captured moments. Best of all, the price for this camera on Amazon was the best we could find on the internet. If you need all the features we were looking for, you can't go wrong with this camera at the Amazon price.

Reviews.Title: A HEAVYWEIGHT AMONG THE LIGHTWEIGHTS
Reviews.Author: cesar gemino
Reviews.Content: This camera  produces sharp pictures and fast .And most of the time If there is some light indoors I don't use the flash anymore.The colors comes out much more vivid......I'm a student artist And I use this camera to take pictures of my subjects and  pictures of my finished works.This camera has tons of features that I have'nt tried yet.Even manual adjustments.....THIS IS EASILY THE BEST CAMERA I'VE EVER HAD.

Reviews.Title: Fine replacement for my ZS-3.
Reviews.Author: Raymond J. Iadanza "itsmeRay"
Reviews.Content: I love taking lots of pictures. On my last vacation I spilled mimosa all over my ZS-3. It got all gunked up, everything was sticky and it needed a good cleaning. When this camera came up for $129, I couldn't resist. It was half the price of my beloved ZS-3 and I was hoping it would work at least half as good.It works better than expected. The zoom lens is just awesome. Pictures from far away have amazing detail. There are some issues with low light situations (I saw this in previous reviews), but I'm still very satisfied overall. My batteries from the ZS-3 and the charger are the same, so BONUS, I have lots of extras.It's a great camera with a strong lens at an awesome price.

Reviews.Title: Superb!
Reviews.Author: Abe Vigoda "part-time inventor"
Reviews.Content: Pros:1- Excellent photos- Day and Night. The people who complain about blurry night pics need to take Photography 101 (Put the camera on a steady surface or tripod and use the 2-second timer to take the pic so you don't shake the camera)2- For its size the zoom is just incredible! And if you really need to get closer, then set it to 5-megapixels and the optical zoom will get you even closer.3- Again, the zoom is amazing. There is a little button next to the shutter which zooms you in to the max automatically in order to get that close-up shot quickly.4- Battery life is excellent. I took photos all day long without a problem. But I also know what I am doing and hence do not need to use the flash. (Don't you just feel like slapping those amateurs who use the flash when photographing objects/landscapes more than 30 feet away!?!)5- The price was approx $120 back in December 2011.Cons: None what-so-ever.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: Being a professional photographer this camera is a great alternative to lugging me pro gear around. The image quality is excellent. Well worth the price. Being able to manually set f-stops and shutter speeds as well as click to an auto setting is a big plus! Even my wife can use it! (I hope she doesn't see this)

Reviews.Title: nice camera, good value BUT  the dim LCD is a problem
Reviews.Author: Will "willum98e"
Reviews.Content: nice camera. havent had it long but used max telephoto (what I bought it for). excellent definition, easy to use, images crisp even when my hands werent braced. after reading other reviews I was surpised that the wide angle indoor with flash worked well.the controls are not intuitive but easy to remember after you use them.I am not in a position to judge skin tones yet and have not used the movie feature. I am guessing that 32gb of memory and 2 batteries would suffice for a one week vacation trip (like a cruise).I upgraded from a 6 mpixel fuji. this is a good camera for someone who doesnt want to lug around a neck killer and maybe I will leave the flip home also.I use 35mm kodachrome slides (nikon, 105) scanned as a benchmark for performance. so far... its close but I dont expect miracles either. a full frame should yield a nice 11x14.update.  still happy but I do have one issue with this camera.  without a rangefinder  I am slaved to the lcd viewer which is totally washed out in sunlight.  accurate framing becomes impossible.  to put it another way,  this camera is useless on a beach or boat.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: R. Tickle "RATickle"
Reviews.Content: If you are in the market for a Point & Shoot SuperZoom you need to jump on this deal before it's gone.  The website says these cameras are used, but I'm not convinced.  I've ordered two in the last week (liked the first so much I ordered one for a friend) and they both arrived in pristine condition.  The ZS9 is essentially the same camera as the ZS8.  The ZS8 is being offered for $70 more (as of this writing).Don't get me wrong.  All Point & Shoots are a compromise.  It won't work that well is low light and macro mode will be fuzzy around the edges, but it has 16x optical zoom and image stabilization.  Also, it will fit in your shirt pocket and it costs 110 bucks (as of this writing). No one says this has to be your only camera.

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera
Reviews.Author: michael houlihan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so I wouldn't have to lug around my 'big' cameras all the time.  It works beautifully and does everything a point and shoot camera should do.  The pictures are excellent, the zoom and macro work really well, and various settings allow for creativity and experimentation.  Well worth the price, you won't be disappointed as long as you understand this is a point and shoot, not a dslr!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Simple,Fun,Great, Pix's. What a Zoom!!
Reviews.Author: Thomas W. Church "Tom Church"
Reviews.Content: I have been checking on this camera type for some time, Saw the  e-mail add. Good price,free shiping and I bought it... Out of the box I started using it.. Christmas I shot the family In doors and out. All types of lighting, never used the flash.. WoW. what great pix's..It's all I hoped for. I would say most people will love this camera..Tom From Florida.

Reviews.Title: A Good Camera with reasonable price
Reviews.Author: ET "veerod"
Reviews.Content: I was trying to find the best compact camera around $100-$200 and after reading many reviews, I decided on ZS9.  Picture quality, ease of use and functionality are all very good for my non-professional applications.  My initial worry of replacing expensive spare panasonic batteries with 3rd party products might cause incompatibility "firmware" issues as some of the reviews indicated turned out to be not a problem.  I took one star off as the software does not fully support Mac as it does for PC.  The iPhoto on Mac does, however, recognize new files and can import photo or video files without any problems.

Reviews.Title: First Digital Carera
Reviews.Author: Mikej
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera so there is a bit of a learning curve. I absolutely love the pictures my ZS9 takes. I'm also glad it came with downloadable software because the paper instructions were only part of what I've had to learn. So far I've only used the iA mode of taking pics and they are great. I would definatly buy this camera again. I got great info from a couple of reviewers prior to purchasing the camera and I'm very grateful to them for taking the time to give me advise.  The biggest reason I bought the ZS9 was because of the zoom lens and just as I hoped it works really great. I've managed to get some great close-up shots of wildlife I would not have been able to get without the 16X zoom. I also like the auto focus and face recognition features as well. I'm looking forward to using the portrait mode when I go up north to see my grandkids this summer as well as the movie mode. So far I'm a very happy customer. The folks at Amazon once again did a great job of shipping my camera quickly and in perfect shape.

Reviews.Title: Very, very good for that price
Reviews.Author: den
Reviews.Content: I'm so satisfied purchasing this Panasonic camera! I just got it and checked functions of this camera and I have to tell you, guys, it's much better than my previous camera Canon SX230 HS which I've returned little earlier. Panasonic camera's picture quality is much, much better. It's made directly in Japan which says a lot... I only complain about quality in low light conditions but if you go outside to make a picture or put the light on- this camera is the best choice! More over, it makes very good quality HD video. I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased with the Panazonic Lumix ZS9
Reviews.Author: Zach J. "ZJulius"
Reviews.Content: I have previously owned a Canon Powershot SD 790IS as well as a Fujifilm Finepix S3300 camera, and I can say that I am the most pleased with this camera over the other two. The Canon took nice pictures, but did not have HD video recording and only a 3x optical zoom. The Fujifilm had nice video quality but the audio quality was lacking and taking pictures in low light setting while indoors proved very difficult. Going from the Fujifilm camera to this one, I can say that I am very very pleased with how the Panasonic takes pictures.PROS:-I've taken lots of pictures indoors while owning this camera, and I'm very pleased with how the Intelligent Auto setting captures the room- pictures turn out clear with little noise, even with only a lamp as a light source.-Pictures in lower-light settings are much better than I expected for a point and shoot of this price.-The zoom capability is very good- much better than lots of other point and shoot cameras.-The different scene modes are easy to find and there is a good number of scenes from which to choose (some of the more interesting setting include Soft Skin, Transform, Food, Party, Candlelight, Beach, and Snow, among others).-The flash has worked very well for me, even though it's not necessary in lots of settings.-The amount of time it takes to focus and take a picture is short.CONS: A bit thicker than most point and shoots, some noise with zoomed-in shots indoors, not the best Panorama setting I've seen. (However, I wouldn't recommend starting a search for another camera because of these things).Sadly I can't comment on the battery power as I haven't used it to its full potential but I did buy a backup just in case. Overall, this camera is definitely worth the price for a point and shoot camera. Anyone looking for a good point and shoot camera will be very happy with this one.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS9 a steal at $130!!!!
Reviews.Author: gafleeman
Reviews.Content: I received this camera yesterday and I am pleasantly surprised at the quality.I have been using a Kodak EasyShare DX7440 for many years and it was time to upgrade.This camera is loaded with features that can't be beat at $130 and free shipping.Best Buys has this camera now for $270 and Samsclub $250 for the ZS8 which doesn't have the stereo recording.It seems to have all the bells and whistles of some of the cameras that costs much more.The pictures I've taken indos are very clear and our lighting is not the best. The outdoor shots with full zoom are vey clear.The firmware that is in this is 1.0 which will support some off brand batteries.Speaking of off brand batteries there was note in the manual about counterfeit batteries over heating that don't have the thermal protection needed.I've used after market batteries before with no problems but beware.I ordered the 2 battery pk from thememstore (which have been getting good reviews)for $20 + shipping which will be here next week.I emailed them and they said the batteries would work but they could be returned for a refund.I will leave a follow up if any problems arise from their batteries.I also ordered the case Logic case and it is a tight fit but it works.I couldn't be happier with this purchase.Thanks Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Worst Digital Camera I've Owned!!!
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I REALLY wanted to like this camera. I've been playing around with it for a few months now and most of my photos are just not very good. I read the whole manual and really tried to make the pictures look good because there are obviously many others who have had good luck with it based on reviews. I am not a camera expert and mostly use the iA mode indoors. Here are the problems I'm having (feel free to comment and let me know if I'm doing something wrong or if there's a way to correct any of these issues):1. If my kids move AT ALL they become a see-through very blurry object. I'll upload a photo later as an example. But this is my #1 concern since my kids move their head, arms, legs or SOMETHING in almost every photo I take. I tried to take pictures of them on their new swingset and trampoline, but they were unrecognizably blurry. If my toddler moves her arm up when I take a picture, her arm is a see through blurry blob while the rest of the photo looks good. I know there are a bunch of settings I can learn about that might help each situation, but since my kids are doing different things in different directions, I can't keep changing settings and shutter speeds hoping to take a good action shot. I thought iA would do this automatically. PLEASE let me know how I can fix this before the camera meets the trash bin. My 6-year-old Canon A640 never had this issue. It could focus on the subject and take a good non-blurry photo even if they moved, which I would expect this camera to do based of the rave reviews.2. My indoor photos are grainy and blurry. I hold the camera steady, but they are so blurry that I'm embarrassed to have to use them on my blog and elsewhere. Again, this is using iA. If I have to crop the photo at all I'm in trouble. I find myself apologizing a lot for my poor quality photos. I've made sure all the settings are set at optimum photo and video quality. I'm sure I could mess around with the many settings and find one that produces a better photo, but I was hoping for an easy point & shoot since I'm not good at photography.3. The corners, especially the lower left corner, are dark in many of my indoor photos. In reading other reviews, I see this same issue addressed and it seems to be a flaw with this design. I have to zoom a little or turn off the flash to avoid the darkened corner, which is disappointing.My last issue is no fault of this camera. The videos are uploaded as .MOV as opposed to .AVI like my Canon. This is not supported by my photo editing software I use daily. Big bummer! The movies download fine, but cannot be played unless I open a different program, so I need to figure that one out.I am very disappointed because I love the look and feel of this camera. It seems to be very sturdy and should last a long time. The zoom is great and video quality seems to be good so far. The battery lasts for a long time and recharges in only 2 hours. I really wish it took better quality photos, especially since I'm past the time I can return it! Guess I'm stuck with it for now.

Reviews.Title: Good Digicam
Reviews.Author: Ishtar
Reviews.Content: I've spent a few months now with this camera and taken hundreds of pictures and plenty of videos.  Here is my take.Pros:- Incredible Price- Battery life is excellent even with flash and constantly using zoom- Decent flash at this price point- Incredible ZoomCons:- Poor picture quality- Poor video quality- I find it a little bulky and I wish it was smaller, but I realize this is a trade-off for the zoomAs others have said, if you have plenty of outside light then the pictures are good, but almost any digicam can do that.  Where digicams are tasked is when there is a need for the flash or how the electronics might predict the need for an ISO change.  It simply doesn't do a very good job of this.  Some pictures are way overexposed and some are underexposed.  Also, I find the HD video quality really lacking and very soft.As I mentioned above, at this price point you really can't go too wrong, but I was expecting more.____________________________________________****UPDATE****I've gotten to spend much more time with this camera and have increased the rating.  Before I mention why let me say that I too am experiencing what others have noticed where a shadow appears on the very corner of some images.  It isn't an entire deal killer for me because I only see it in macro shots, which I rarely take.Here is what I will say about this camera that I really like, that is, it does do a great job of being there when you need it.  What I'm finding is that I hardly have any shots that I miss.  With my previous digicam I would see some pics afterwards had poor lighting or came out blurred.  With this camera it gets it.  It is rare that I see some images that really WOW me because I still thing the overall quality could be improved, but still I do have to give credit where credit is due and in this case it does a great job of capturing the moment albeit with not perfect clarity.The rest of what I reflected above in the review still stands.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: dalex
Reviews.Content: I got my DMC-ZS9 2 weeks ago and I'm thoroughly pleased with it. Takes great pics in low light or daytime conditions. The LCD screen is bright and clear. The camera itself has a nice weight to it. It doesn't look or feel cheap or like a toy. The black metal finish looks classy and high-end. The zoom is great!

Reviews.Title: If reliable the deal of a lifetime
Reviews.Author: JHC
Reviews.Content: Received from Amazon on time with good packaging and no shipping damage.Have spent a week with the camera and the disk based user manual, spend the time to read it - worthwhile.The modes are intuitive however I have had better macro pics in aperture priority with no flash and good lighting.Color is excellent.All resolutions yield good photos given decent lighting with 14M being outstanding.Scene High Speed Burst Mode at 3M and Good Quality selected gives continuous shooting with decent pictures,I setthis as MS2.Video quality good at both VGA and HD. Hold steady and zoom/pan judiciously, any problems have been my technique.This camera feels well built and a great size/weight. If this unit has long term reliability it is unbeatable forprice, features quality.Update 1/22/2012After using this camera for a month I continue to be impressed by the quality and capability of this little $130 pocket camera. If Amazon restocks this item buy one for yourself and for anyone who has any interest in photography and video. If photos are taken with at 0 ev little or no software correction is necessary. For free photo editing software get Picasa2, NCHSoftware's PhotoPad Imaging Editor and GIMP2(udpdate coming mid-Feb) all of these have great features with GIMP being the most complex and versatile.For Video editing try NCHSoftware's VideoPad Video editor. Nice, easy to use editor that has a free trial and a free home version.I believe with this camera and this software I have the capability to do anything I want with either stills or video.Update 1/21/2013I have had this camera for over a year and I am more than happy with it. Photos and video still excellent as well as battery life. I didn't need to bother with a spare battery. No wonder it is going for up to $300 used. I just ordered a tripod to do some night and HDR/LDR work with it.This camera will do for me until I can afford an FZ200 but I would still hold onto it as a carry camera.

Reviews.Title: Like my Xmas gift!
Reviews.Author: Ying Xia "Zena"
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera! Could not wait using it right out of the box. Took some nice pictures with it already.Its zoom range is amazing. Took sharp and vivid pictures on different situations. Compact size perfect for girls.IA mode is brilliant too. First I am lazy, second, the best scenery usually disappears in a second or two. I hatetaking my DSL with me all the time. I have a couple of other point-and-shoot cameras in hands too, still workingfine. But now I understand why I need upgrade them every 2-3 years. With the price paid, definitely could affordit. So far so pleased.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: jking
Reviews.Content: So far the zs9 has been a good camera.  It has fast shutter speed and takes good low light pictures under 6X zoom.  Beyond this, the flash struggles, but all the megazoom compact cameras seems to be this way.  The video is great.  Overall a good camera for the $.  Good compact alterative to a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: ALL IS NOT ROSES....but pretty close...
Reviews.Author: Bears Fan Jim "qm2-703"
Reviews.Content: Quality built - Panasonic cameras have very, very few of those lens errors and flash jams of Canon and Nikon, and Fuji.A./  Low-light no-flash pictures are going to need a very steady hand, or a brace or tripod quite often, to get the same lack of blur a considerably more expensive camera can provide. The ZS9 tries so often to use no higher than ISO400 indoors, and to do that it has to slow the shutter down to 1/15 or 1/8...But the results themselves are then pretty good.Because I have used a digital camera since 2001, I did not expect the ZS9 to be an indoor king. For that, I recommend the Canon S-110, which I almost bought for a lot more money, except that I really loved the smooth zoom of the ZS9...Once you use the ZS9 zoom outdoors, you dont want to let it go.B./ What is really fun for the price is that the ZS9 has a GREAT set of full manual(PASM)functions. After 2 months experience, it is my personal favorite way to shoot with this camera, indoors especially,  Set the shutter at 1/30 and leave it. Then it is quite easy to adjust aperture (you need to be in A mode) til the exposure bar is where you want it, then shoot. Very satisfying for stills and portraits, as well as most pet and kid shots. A few tries in a few different lighting conditions, and you are well on your way to photographic fun, instead of just picture-taking.Video is on a near par and above some brands. In normal room lighting, to me the ZS9 has better color, esp. on Automatic white balance.  Outdoors, the video is super !CONCLUSION:I'm keeping my ZS9 till something better for the price comes along, and that may take quite a while. The ZS9 can produce some very good stills and video, it has a very nice zoom, no lens errors or jams, and it is fun to learn what this camera is capable of.

Reviews.Title: Full Manual, Aperture & Shutter Programs also !!!
Reviews.Author: Anil Bakshi "Anil"
Reviews.Content: In addition to iA and Program mode, this camera provides full Manual, Aperture & Shutter priority regimes, that needs to be acknowledged also. Very few P&S; offer this. Allows you to experiment, and DIY option.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Edward T. Medalis
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for almost a year and it has performed flawlessly.  I'm not a photo expert so this rating comes from an average user. The clarity is wonderful. The camera is quite easy and intuitive to use. Looks and feels well built. The zoom is great.I'm totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZS9 opinion
Reviews.Author: enrconc
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an update of my former DMC-ZS3. For $120 I was unable to resist the change. I carry my ZS9 in a pouch on my belt 24-7. The image you want to record is everywhere, you don't know when or where, and this little (not the smallest) camera with all what it gives you cannot disapoint. Perhaps some limit situations, with full zoom and fuzzy background or landscapes, make AF wander a lot, and there is when you miss manual focus. But in 99% of dayly use, it is hard to beat it. Excellent for that convenient price.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: This camera takes pictures so clear you can see the persons pores.  Things that are not seen with the naked eye is shown when pictures are taken. The delivery was in two days.  Thanks again.Wendy

Reviews.Title: Impresionante
Reviews.Author: Harry Quiroz
Reviews.Content: Esta cámara es espectacular, el Zoom es impresionante, las fotos salen muy claras, y por el costo es una de las mejores en el mercado, muy recomendada.

Reviews.Title: I hope a bit more
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Good picture quality- Excellent optical zoom (That's the best feature of this camera)- A lot of optionsCons:- Bad video quality in low light conditionsConclusion:Great camera for pictures and for video with day light, but could be better.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Adrian Pierorazio
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my point-and-shoot camera that recently died.  I've used SLRs for a long time and am under no delusions that this is a replacement for an SLR but it really is a great P+S.  The biggest draw for me for this camera is the wide angle.  I use this camera most for pictures of my children and they don't always back off to telephoto range.  I find myself wanting wide angle more often than telephoto and this camera fits the bill.  The image quality is excellent and it's very easy to use.  Highly recommended as a point-and-shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great product for a great price!
Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: I am incredibly happy with this camera. After using an outdated Kodak Easyshare for years (and getting great photos out of it), I upgraded to this Panasonic and I am very satisfied with it. My pictures have come out beautifully -- whether they are scenic pictures, family photos, or random candid shots -- and the zoom is amazing. There are some naysayers here who have issues with this camera, and that is fine -- but if you are a regular every day sort of person who is technologically inclined enough, but not super duper knowledgable, then this camera will not disappoint. The HD video quality is incredibly clear, as is the sound. My only issue is the flash exposure can sometimes be overwhelming, especially with close ups, however this could probably be easily fixed by changing the flash settings. I usually just turn off the flash to avoid this problem. Aside from this very minor issue, this camera is great. Tons of settings that will suit just about any environment for great picture taking.
