Easy to use and operate once you toy around with it for a bit. I haven't used it on a long trip or over a long enough period of time to really tell just yet, but the battery life has been great so far. Much longer than my old Kodak (which would usually stay alive for 2-3 days of a trip without needing a charge or replacement). The charger is also portable and super easy to use.I would recommend this camera 100%. Great quality, great price. If you are just looking for a great camera for family photos, events, trips, etc., you really can't go wrong here. :)

Reviews.Title: Lumix ZS9
Reviews.Author: daffydrakes
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera $130 can buy! Easy to use,great zoom and great printable pictures! Beats a Sony hands down for 1/3 the price!!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Buy!
Reviews.Author: Arrowhead
Reviews.Content: You will not go wrong buying this camera. It will make you look like a great photographer without spending any time at all figuring out how to use it. I could not be happier with this camera. Even if you have a DSLR, everyone needs something this size. Thank you, Panasonic and Amazon.

Reviews.Title: An Outstanding value !
Reviews.Author: DMM-NH
Reviews.Content: I have been involved with photography for over fifty years. I have owned and used extensively Leicas, Rolleis,  Hasselblads, Linhof View cameras, the whole Nikon line from  rangefinder through SLRs (both film and digital). This camera, small, extremely portable, quick to use is the sort of camera Henri Cartier Bresson would use were he still alive and active. What first attracted me to this camera (Panasonic DMC-ZS9) was the Leica Vario-Elmar lens. I'd used the SLR version of this lens for years. I was surprised to see it on this sort of camera. Then I realized that this Panasonic camera was virtually identical to one of Leica's digital cameras. The main difference was in the price. The Leica was more than twice as much, not surprising, Leicas have always cost much more than most cameras. But they usually were unique. This time, it is quite obvious that Panasonic is making the camera for Leica and using one of their famous lens designs.The camera is a joy to use. The controls are handy and thorough. My sole complaint is the lack of a viewfinder. That is due to my age and old habits. I like looking at my subject through a viewfinder. On the other side, using the large viewing screen  makes it quite easy to  keep lines straight. It is like using a miniature view camera. One thing this camera has that a lot of old photographers always wanted is a way to see one's subject in black and white. Press a couple of buttons and this desire instantly becomes a reality.

Reviews.Title: So far, freaking fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Spottedfire
Reviews.Content: January 5, 2012 This is Day 2, and the day I really got to try out this camera. It takes GREAT pictures!!! The zoom is incredible and goes up to 44x (pictures aren't allways as clear when using the full zoom button). My only gripe is that in low light the pictures are a bit pixelated. The flash destroyes the pixel-y look of it though. There are many picture settings, but I prefer the iA more. To see pictures it has taken, visit my DeviantArt: [...]I'll edit my review as the week goes on :)

Reviews.Title: HELP! Haven't Seen This Mentioned ***UPDATED***
Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: I received my ZS9 a week ago and really, really want to love it. Like many others, I read tons of reviews before deciding on this camera. I was so excited when it arrived and loved the looks and feel of it. Unfortunately, I noticed immediately that almost all my indoor pictures have a dark corner on the lower left side. Wondering if it was an LCD issue, I downloaded the images and the dark corner was still there.So, my question for those who have this same model is ARE YOU HAVING THE SAME PROBLEM? Does this camera produce a dark corner indoors or in low light? The dark corner is gradual, meaning the picture fades into the darker area in the very corner, almost like my finger was in the way slightly, providing a slight shadow. We thought it was normal at first until we realized that many of the photos ONLY had this dark corner in the lower left area and none of the other corners were effected. Also, it is not an issue when I zoom in or turn the flash off. But I do see the dark corner in many of my indoor photos using the different camera settings, with the flash on, not zooming in at all. Some photos you can barely see the dark corner and other photos it's pretty noticeable.UPDATE 1/24/12:I've uploaded 4 photos to Amazon on the main product page of this camera. They all have notes added to them to help you distinguish them from some of the other uploaded pictures from other customers. There's a picture of a chef plate, our entryway, our living room carpet, and my old camera. Let me know if you think it's a normal low-light dark shadow or not. My pictures turn out fine outside and in brighter light. Hmmmm...UPDATE 2/2/12:Those who have commented on my review have been very helpful (and have noticed this same problem with their ZS9 cameras). It turns out that Panasonic is aware of this dark shadow in the lower left corner and mentioned it on pg 41 of the downloadable manual (thanks J. Conner!). It seems to be in low light settings when the flash is turned on and you don't zoom in at all. This just happened to be how I took the first several photos when I received the camera which is why I noticed it right away. I have changed my rating from 2 stars and given the camera 4 stars. I use the camera in my home a lot to take pictures of various items, so I will just have to zoom a little or turn the flash off to avoid the dark corner. Not a deal breaker, but worthy of losing 1 star since I use these particular settings enough.Love everything else so far! The sturdy feel of the camera, crisp photos, excellent videos (and the fact that you CAN zoom while videoing is wonderful and was one of my requirements for my next digital camera). The battery compartment is sturdy and built to last. The camera I'm replacing had a cheap PLASTIC battery door with plastic components inside that broke and had to be replaced numerous times. This one is metal and designed well. All the photos I have taken outside and in better lighting have turned out great without a hint of the shadowy corner issue. Worth the $129 for sure, despite the one flaw.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a fantastic price
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my Canon A620. The Canon is fine but only has a 4x zoom and I wanted more (don't we always!). I did my due diligence and read tons of reviews for several days. I narrowed it down to these: Panasonic DMC-ZS8, Panasonic DMC-ZS10, Nikon S9100, and Sony DSC-HX9V. The Sony was way too expensive although it may be the best camera of the bunch. The Nikon appears to have quality issues on the zoom lens causing lockups. Otherwise it was my personal favorite. The DMC-ZS10 has a new CMOS sensor that, probably in combination with the camera software, seems to produce noisy photos. The DMC-ZS8 pictures with its CCD imager are reported to be better.Then I found the built-for-Amazon DMC-ZS9. It is basically a DMC-ZS8 with stereo mics as near as I can tell. At any rate it is a fantastic little camera for the (currently) $129 price tag. Picture quality is quite nice. Program Mode does better than iAuto, especially for indoor flash pictures. I have been just leaving it in Program Mode for everything. Also the iZoom feature extends the zoom to 21x while still retaining good picture quality. It is easy to use yet has advanced features for those who want them.I have only two nits with this camera. 1) the LCD is only 230K pixels which is a step down from the previous model's 460K and 2) the zoom could have more steps (smoother). Otherwise, I really like this camera - so much so that I bought a second one for my wife!

Reviews.Title: What a Deal!
Reviews.Author: Trader Mike
Reviews.Content: I was wanting a small camera because I don't carry my DSLR everywhere.  When I came across this camera on Amazon for only $129 I snapped it up.  Glad I did.  Takes great pictures and even better videos.  They even look good on my flatscreen!  Plus it has full manual controls (P,A,S,M).  The only thing I'd change so far is an easier way to change the ISO.  I suggest you get this while you can for such a low price....  As far as low light- it's fine.  If you want DSLR performace, get a DSLR.  Or at least spend twice as much or more for a top of the line Canon.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic camera review
Reviews.Author: John L. Thompson
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazingly clear photos and is extremely easy to use  The zoom feature is really good and I love the fact that I don't have to be close to my subject to get clear close=ups.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed!
Reviews.Author: Smiling
Reviews.Content: Three days before Christmas Eve I dropped my camera (also a Panasonic Lumix) and it fell right on the zoom lens making it forever unuseable. Once I calmed down, I realized I might have luck ordering through Amazon. Sure enough the Panasonic DMC-ZS9 Lumix was on sale and could be delivered in two days guaranteed! I had signed on for "Prime" free trial and it was wonderful. When the camera arrived I charged the battery for about 2 hours and started taking pictures. I have not had time to read all the instructions but was able to take clear beautiful pictures with no problem. Would highly recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Takes lovely photos
Reviews.Author: lizpool
Reviews.Content: UPDATE***This camera takes lovely photos so I changed my rating to 4 stars. The camera was fixed when I sent it off to the TX Valley.I want to say, while it was working, the camera took beautiful photos.I purchase this camera November 13 and took many lovely bird photos with it.  On January 19, while photographing American Robins, a black dot appeared in the view finder.  Sure enough, when I downloaded the camera, the spot was on the photos.I immediately called Panasonic. They gave me instructions on sending the camera in for repair.  They were very nice and since I had the camera only 2 months, it, of course, was still under warranty.The camera arrived at the McAllen Center on January 23 and they have been trying to decide on a course to take since then. The camera is "TOO NEW" and they don't know what to do with it. They don't know what is wrong with it because it is "TOO NEW".  They can't send me a replacement camera because it is "TOO NEW". I am not kidding, they used those exact words!When I call in for a status update, they have to look up my case by name because the camera model number is "TOO NEW" to be in the system!Today, January 31, they have decided to order parts to fix it.  (Keep in mind they still don't know what's wrong with it but the "middle management" has chosen that course of action.IT WILL TAKE 4 TO 6 WEEKS TO GET THE PARTS.  Mean while---No camera.

Reviews.Title: Christmas Suprise
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for my mother (approaching 60 and not tech savvy at all) for a Christmas present.  She still was using an old film camera and in need of an upgrade.  After searching Amazon for inexpensive, easy to use digital cameras we happened upon this one.We decided to order it right before Christmas fully expecting it to come after the holidays, we were pleasantly surprised when it came two days before Christmas!  I took it out of the box to charge it so she could use it on Christmas day, plus I wanted to see if she could figure it out enough just to point and shoot pictures.I must say, while I do not claim to be a professional photographer by any stretch of the imagination, it was easy to figure out and takes excellent pictures!  My mom was thrilled and was able to get a fairly good grasp on how to use this camera fairly quickly.Overall we were very pleased with the camera and Amazon for getting this order to us so promptly!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, except for dust on inside of lens and sensor!!!
Reviews.Author: ottovonbraun
Reviews.Content: About a year after I bought this, a big spot showed up in the center of all my photos, and then more spots. Then I started reading dozens of complaints about Panasonic DMC cameras having problems with dust getting inside the lens and on the sensor. The camera takes really good pictures and video. The battery lasts pretty good considering the big LCD screen. Even though the dust is on the inside of the lens, it shows up badly in pictures. I would not buy another Panasonic camera due to the dust problems. I used my Canon Powershot for 6 years and never had spots in pictures. I am sending the camera in to Panasonic to be fixed, though most people say that the dust gets sucked back on the sensor within a month due to the vacuum created when the zoom goes out.

Reviews.Title: Great Lumix ZS9
Reviews.Author: applecider
Reviews.Content: The ZS9 is cheaper than the ZS8. I bought the ZS9 to replace my ZS8 which will no longer focus properly after being dropped on the cement. It has the same features as the ZS8 plus stereo sound recording which I did not need.It takes great pictures in low light and indoors without using the flash. It still has sharp focus at full optical zoom outdoors while being hand held. It fits in your pocket. The battery is good for a couple of days of shooting, but I still take the battery charger with me on overnight trips.

Reviews.Title: Great everyday camera!
Reviews.Author: Mare Grishem "Rebel Caddie"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for catching little kids on the move.  It doesn't take long to focus, so it is easier to get a quick, clear shot.  It is not a complicated camera and is user friendly.  I also love that it goes into a sleep mode if it is accidentally left on, which will save the battery.

Reviews.Title: panosonic lumix camera
Reviews.Author: Louise A. Byron "color crazy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the high MP's and high zoom. It is nice that is it also so small, and lightweight. I have used it considerably, but have not used very many features as of yet. It appears to have good photographic quality, and I will continue to discover all of it's many features with time... The price was fabulous at $129.00... I did not expect it to be of such good quality for that money... I am pleased. thank you, Louise

Reviews.Title: A pocket camera for serious photographrers
Reviews.Author: Geoff404
Reviews.Content: I own a couple of digital SLR bodies and I am a pretty serious photographer at times, but at other times I just want a camera that fits in my pocket. However the techie in me wants the pocket camera to be capable of some pretty good photography if its all I have when one of those moments happens. There are only a few brands of cameras out there that have a line of cameras that fit the bill for this.These Lumix cameras are some pretty serious "point and shoot" cameras, capable of producing some publishable and/or sellable  photos, if you're among those who know what it means to take it to the limits. My first ever digital camera was an early point and shoot Coolpix, just a 1 megapixel camera, but even with that I took a few shots that ended up published and earned me $50 checks. This camera? No doubt it can do the same, and with 14 megapixles no doubt it can do considerably more too.Take control of the camera. Pretty much everything your SLR can do, this camera can also do, although yes there are limitations. But limitations are also challenges that can be overcome. Sure they aren't as fast, the sensor is smaller, and so much more that could be said against a camera like this one, but it comes down to my SLR with power pack, a 300mm lens, or even an 80-200 zoom, thats not all going to fit in a shirt pocket. If I could change one thing about this camera, it would be that I'd include a way to use a few basic filters on it. The lens, by the way, is simply amazing. At full 16X zoom, its not Leica sharp like what you're thinking, but did you really expect it to be? For the price? Its still plenty good though, and no doubt a tripod and timer would improve this. I haven't had the time to try it yet, but I will soon enough.The macro capability is stunning, this alone is worth the $129 price.The video looks great. It looks better than some of the stuff I've seen made with digital, high definition camcorders. No kidding.This camera gets a "wow!" rating from me. At $129 shipped (at the time I am writing this) what are you waiting for? It's a steal at that price.

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: mcahunter
Reviews.Content: Very impressed so far.  This replaces a canon elph and appears to be of similar quality as the canon, which we really liked.  The best thing so far is the very intuitive hard-button controls instead of the complex software menus on the canon.  Makes it much easier to do the typical setting changes you want to see.  Zoom moves in and out quite fast and focus is OK, but a little slower than we would like.  Colors & quality of photos are as good as our canon was, and better than you would expect for such a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy !
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I received much more than I expected when I ordered the Pamasonic DMC-ZS9. Delivery was prompt and secure. Item was well packaged. The camera itself is easy to use,very user-friendly and small for all it offers. It is great for a pro or a neophyte. Fun and handy.

Reviews.Title: Another very good camera...
Reviews.Author: Leon Photo
Reviews.Content: A versatile camera that can do a terrific job copying and  practically any other type of photography with relative ease.  Drop it into your pocket or purse and you will always be covered on taking pictures

Reviews.Title: ZS9 black specs on every photo
Reviews.Author: Happy Homemaker
Reviews.Content: I bought the ZS9 a couple of years ago when Amazon had a lightning deal and have been fairly satisfied.  The zoom is phenomenal and the pause between photos is acceptable, however, the shortfall is that dust specs get inside the camera every 4-6 months.  I found an online video that shows how to take the camera apart and clean the dust off the photo screen...not sure if that's what it's called... But you take a cotton swab and wipe it out and you're good as new.  It takes time and patience to take it apart and put back together again.  I'm getting weary of tearing it apart every few months, so, I'm shopping for something different.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: celena
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have had it for 2 years and have never had any issues with it. It's a great camera if all you want to do is take simple family photos. My pictures come out great. It's easy to use and small enough to fit in a purse.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Heather E. Mueller
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this camera. However I have somehow gotten dirt inside the lens and cannot get it out. Don't think it's a camera flaw though...

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Dejae Rules "can't stop financing."
Reviews.Content: this thing is easy to use and comes with a ton of features, most of which a person can figure out without looking at the manual.  for the cost, even two years later, i don't have any regrets other than wishing it had wi-fi (naturally, cameras started having that like 2 months after i got this - popping out the sd card and sticking it in my pc is still quite easy, though).  the body is very solid and the camera turns on and shoots quickly.  it easily fits in a purse or cargo pocket.  i recommend it to anyone who doesn't want to drag a big camera bag all over just to get a nice picture.

Reviews.Title: Lense cover defective
Reviews.Author: L. Geiges
Reviews.Content: I used this camera about 10 times in the two weeks I had it.  Then the lens cover began not fully retracting when I turned on the camera.  I took many photos wondering why there was a big fuzzy dark area on the upper left side of my photos.  Also, the lens cover would not fully close when I turned off the camera.  I shipped it back to Amazon the next day.Note that the camera had not been dropped or even bumped since I got it.Extremely disappointed, as my knowledgeable brother had highly recommended the Lumix brand.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Raoul Harlan
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and videos, I was amazed how good the videos came out. One of the main reasons I picked this camera was because of the Leica Lens. I just wish it had the view finder, that would be my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Marianne Hubach
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on a consumer reports magazine description.  It is easy to use, easy to carry -- it can fit easily in a small purse or even in your pocket -- takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Panasonic DMC-ZS9 14.1 MP
Reviews.Author: nahart "nahart"
Reviews.Content: Excellent,used in many vacation we have taken and not one time  let me down satified with this camera in use for 2 years now and hundreds of pictures

Reviews.Title: Works great until you use it on a windy day.
Reviews.Author: Giz Mo Zart
Reviews.Content: This is the second Panasonic DMC camera I bought.  The first one got a speck of dust inside the lens on a windy day so all the photos had a blur spot.  Bought another thinking it was a fluke, nope it wasn't.  One month later the second camera gets the same blur spot on the photos.  They won't cover it under warranty because they say it's sand.  Bottom line, there is just too little seal protection for the lenses from wind blown debris.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Frederick W. Ebbrecht
Reviews.Content: Great little point and shoot camera. I use solely on automatic, as I am not a big camera guy. This thing takes excellent outdoor photos, and the zoom, and anti shake functions are tremendous. Where you suffer slightly is with indoor photos. They are generally acceptable, but like most smaller point and shoots are not great in low light situations where you need the flash. I'd like a wifi option to post photos directly to face book, and wirelessly transfer photos. I understand newer models have these options, but the cameras are expensive.

Reviews.Title: whatta buy
Reviews.Author: east bay barry
Reviews.Content: got it for my wife to upgrade her camera, taken it on several trips.  great pictures, easy and intuitive to use, zoom range is fantastic.  packs easily, light and doesn't take up too much space, well balanced.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix Camera
Reviews.Author: From Me To You
Reviews.Content: Takes nice crisp outdoor photos.  Relatively good indoor photos.  And "so so" close up shots.Real nice having a the 16X optical zoom...

Reviews.Title: Super little camera with big features.
Reviews.Author: Craig Konowalski
Reviews.Content: I use this camera for work (I'm a Real Estate Appraiser) so I take hundreds of pictures a week.  This camera has a nice wide angle lense, a good zoom and is easy to carry.  I have to say, that the only negative about the camera is that it does not take very good photos when zoomed to the max.  However, I can say the same about most pocket sized cameras I've used in the past.I've been using this particular camera for a few years now and I can tell you that it is a tough little bugger. One of the biggest pluses of this unit, is the fact that you can take hundreds of photos on ONE charge...really!!!  I often use it all day long, for 3 or 4 days before I have to recharge it. Secondly, it is very fast to get to be ready for the first picture, when you turn it on.  ALSO...it is very quick between photos.  I don't feel like I have to wait an eternity so I can take my next shot, like with some other cameras I've used.As long as you're not doing portraits, this is a great little camera.  It's great for trips...with it's wide angle lense and 16x zoom AND long life battery.

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing
Reviews.Author: Suki
Reviews.Content: I compared two pictures of the same thing side by side. One with this camera and the other one with my previous camera and the difference is amazing. The pictures are crisp and colors stand out. If I went back in time, I would buy it all over again.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: After fighting with cheap cameras, or cameras that are too complicated, we finally settled on this one based on other reviews and I've been very happy with it.  Finally a camera that you can just point, shoot and get decent pictures without worry.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Buster Braun
Reviews.Content: I've had this digital camera for 1 & 1/2 years and am very satisfied with its quality and features.  The lithium battery has a long life between charges.  The camera is easy to use the basic functions.  To be honest, I have not mastered all of the options that the camera offers.  However, this camera is more than adequate for my needs.

Reviews.Title: dmczs9
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I always find myself expecting more from cameras. I believe that I've put the fastest sd card there is in this. Still, unless not using a flash it takes a bit to get the picture to click. Had to take photos that aren't posed for.I guess I miss good old fashion cameras that you push the button and it takes the picture right now. Not after it focus's and all that jazz. A camera isn't meant to think. It should always be in focus and you shouldn't have to wait 1/2 to full second for the thing to snap the photo.Does anyone remember when you could open the christmas presents and mom and dad would just snap the photos. The only lag there was with those cameras was just moving the film.All this new technology and the photos just aren't any better than a good quality photo from the 80s.I would like a camera that you point and click, that has a flash that immediately shoots the picture. If it can't be done digitally then maybe we should go back to the old days. Printer ink cost so much no one developes (or prints) as much as they did when I was young. Alot of photos that are good for the computer. Until the computer malfuntions... Then no photos to give to the kids.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Kamille Singh
Reviews.Content: This camera is really nice, esp. the intelligent zoom. I would recommend it to anyone. It was a really good buy.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase at the right price
Reviews.Author: Jerry Bergman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera during the Cyber Monday sale a year ago. I purchased it for around $100 and for that price, it’s a good camera. We took this with us on 2 vacations, and both times it has been just fine. Easy to attach a mini tripod to, easy to carry, I don’t do all the bells and whistles,  but for basic photos it’s fine

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Stacy Keister
Reviews.Content: Great pics, easy to use, multiple settings to get feel for the right colors, etc. Would recommend if wanting easy point and shoot camera with beautiful pictures that have great details.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: ladybug
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for the price and meets my needs. Great zoom for a compact camera. There are many features that I haven't even tried yet, but that's because I don't spend a lot of time learning it.  For taking vacation pics, etc., it's great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: contagiousjeff
Reviews.Content: Lots of good glass on the front, this is great for a small point and shoot, best I've had so far. Nothing shoots like a 35mm, but you can't put one in your pocket. I've had it for a year of constant use, and it still works as well as the day I got it. I guess the only drawback is that it's not a 35mm camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Little camera.
Reviews.Author: MJS
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I had another one but it was stolen. Glad I was able to find a replacement as I had extra batteries and chargers for it. Looking forward to taking more great photos!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic still running the game with great point and shoot video quality
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Still a great series by Panasonic, because of its video quality I would recommend no other camera for wildlife viewing.

Reviews.Title: great buy!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: my daughter loves her new camera. She takes pictures everywhere she goes...school/camp/it's endless.This was a great buy. We love it:)

Reviews.Title: Panasonic dented my camera while it was in for repair and wants me to pay for their damage
Reviews.Author: B. Baniszewski "Beth"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera last year for Christmas.  I was very happy with how such nice optics fit in such a small package.  A few weeks ago, I noticed that the flash wasn't working and the mode indicator dial wouldn't always register the correct position.  Since the camera was still under warranty, I sent it in for repairs.I got a call from Panasonic a week later telling me that the warranty was void because of a small dent on the camera's mode indicator dial, and since the dent was in one of my problem areas, they claimed the warranty was void.  There was no dent when I sent the camera in for repairs.Panasonic said that it is their policy to keep the packaging of any package which looks like it was damaged in shipping.  They did not keep the packaging for my camera, since it had shown no signs of damage.  I talked to a number of people at the post office, and they also had no record of damage.  The only logical conclusion left was that the camera was damaged at Panasonic's repair facility.Panasonic, of course, insists they do not damage cameras, and that it is not possible for a camera to be even accidentally damaged at their facility.  They told me several times they would have a manager call me back to speak to me about the situation.  No one ever did.  Every time I called again, I was told the manager was unavailable.  I got no help from anyone at their support center.  I only got brushed off.My camera had no dent when I sent it in.  It was sitting untouched on a table between the last time I used it and the time I noticed it was malfunctioning.  Panasonic treated my camera negligently at their facility. Now they want to charge me more than the cost of the camera to have it repaired, when it should still be under warranty.Panasonic sold me an unreliable product, damaged it further instead of repairing it, and gave me terrible customer service.  I will never buy any product or service from them again, and I encourage you to avoid them as well.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Ramona L Dibble
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures and I love the size and super zoom that it has.  I can take all of the pictures I need with this camera

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera - great value
Reviews.Author: Roger Hickman
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to operate and takes great pictures.  The zoom is incrediable.  It is  a little bulky though.

Reviews.Title: perfect compact camera beats SLR's
Reviews.Author: shore times
Reviews.Content: this perfectly made and right-priced Panasonic DMC compact is so awesome I bought 3 of them (2 as gifts) - I take it everywhere and constantly whip it out and shoot on the fly - 90% hit rate on random pics. that show awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Norma Ross ""fair"  finder"
Reviews.Content: LOVE this camera and feel like I got a great deal. Still figuring out all the bells and whistles, it's a terrific camera and fits our family and all our activities to a T!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZS9 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Kelley
Reviews.Content: I first saw this camera at Staples where I took several shots throughout the store.  Was amazed at the quality of the shots under different lighting conditions, even shots out the front window with bright sun coming through.Found the camera on Amazon and purchased it for a hundred dollars less. I been using it for several months now and can't say anything negative about it.  I like all of the features that Iv'e found so far, still experimenting.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: lucy louise
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. Have not used it a lot since purchase but the photos we have taken have been clear and sharp. Red eye seems to be less of an issue than our old camera. It is a good size and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Point & Shoot Camera for MC Tank Bag
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Steinmetz "colmike"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Panasonic DMC-ZS9 to carry in my motorcycle tank bag.  You never know when you might run across that once in a lifetime photo opportunity, and this remarkably capable point & shoot provides near DSLR results.  Great compact size, but not cheaply built..., has a little heft.  Did I mention that the current price for this camera, just over $110 at the time of this review, is also a remarkable value.  What's not to like.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but low flash range
Reviews.Author: Elby
Reviews.Content: Easy camera to operate. Purchased a Lumix after seeing what my son put his through while stationed in Iraq. Took a licking & kept on ticking! So far I am pretty happy with it. The only disappointing thing so far is the flash range. My old Nikon had double the flash range. With the Lumix in auto-mode, subjects more 10 ft away were not illuminated sufficiently to produce a crisp image. Consumers will want to keep this in mind if they plan to use this indoors.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: T. petersen "Uncle Tom"
Reviews.Content: Great Camera. Really!I shoot quite a bit.This telephoto is outstanding for such a small camera and the wide angle is perfect for getting everything in the shot.Video is great ...... now with zooming capabities .... WOW !!!Have not tried all the other fun things this camera can do, but, I ready think it's the"BEST MONEY CAN BUY" for the price. AND it fits in a pocket !!!!Off to take some Spy Pictures !!!Uncle Thom

Reviews.Title: Great deal on an amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Alicia Hannah
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I've needed one for quite a long time and after reading reviews on the highest rated cameras I chose this one. The price is amazing for the features and quality of this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: This was a gift that I wasn't going to get until Christmas but I opened the box when I picked up the mail. I have enjoyed the pocket-size of this camera because I spend a lot of time in the woods and can't carry extra bulk like a lot of cameras. The zoom is great. The pixels are great. Using the camera is simple, not complex like my wife's camera. It is easy to plug in and transfer pictures to the computer. I have taken some great pics with it already and look forward to enjoying it for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Derek Rubadue
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a christmas present.  Very satisfied.  Great quality pictures, very easy to use.  Should've bought something similar long ago.

Reviews.Title: Best Bang for your buck.
Reviews.Author: S. Pirtle
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent photo quality, Excellent video quality, many features, stereo audio, AMAZING zoom.Cons: Power switch location, bulkyOverall this camera is amazing. This is the second camera I've owned and the first that has HD video recording. The quality is amazing in both pictures and videos. The only thing I did not like is the location of the power switch. Sometimes when I put the camera in its case or in my pocket the switch will accidentally flip on. Also it's a thick camera but that doesn't bother me at all. Honestly for 130 bucks, you can't find a better deal around.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera!
Reviews.Author: Howard Sanders
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews on this product & for anyone looking for good camera that can be a very good point & shoot, this is the camera. Bought this to replace 2 digtal cameras that were 5 & 10 years old. Love it. The zoom is incrediable. Buy extra battery though.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Cindi
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that took good close ups and also wide angle lense for distance.  This camera is a great buy for the money!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Lumix user
Reviews.Content: The is an absolutely outstanding product that I can highly recommend.  It is the fourth camera I have had in this line of products and is the best yet.  The image resolution is outstanding.  If there is any issue with this product it is with taking pictures of the night sky or when it is dark and the flash will not do the job.  I'm sure I'll figure this out......

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Peggy H. Rose
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera - the only thing it doesn't have that I, at least, would like is an eye viewer - I like using them as I think it helps stabilze my hands.  Takes very good, clear pictures even at full zoom.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Paul Palmer
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this camera, and I have been very pleased.  Great features.  Great pictures.  Easy to use.  I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Awesome ZOOM
Reviews.Author: Droid Doug
Reviews.Content: Truly the nicest camera I have ever used and owned. Outstanding value at the price $129.00 UNBELIEVABLE!  Why would you even consider a ZS8. This is my 2nd Lumix camera the 1st being a 9mg and 10x zoom model.  This was a great upgrade I just love the zoom capability. I like that it fits easily into my pocket and ready at anytime.  I have a pet and used the pet age program to tag photos.  Very happy with this product and would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: For the money a great Camera
Reviews.Author: R Hogan
Reviews.Content: Bought here for 129.00,About the same as the ZS8 model and there is also a ZS9 Model for a little more.Anyway pretty pleased with it,plenty of options to tweak your shots,in auto mode its really good enough for most people I would think,Zoom is just outstanding for a camera in this price range.Video seems to be ok and is in stereo unlike the previous model which costs more? Why?Anyway for a cheaper camera to carry in your pocket with a good zoom there is nothing better IMO..Sweet deal!OK I did have a problem with the camera,it seems its easy to get dust into the lens and on the sensor after carrying it around in my coat pocket for a few days,Probably not a good idea to be doing that without a case..So my bad,,Panasonic did clean/fix it for free and got it back like new in about 8 days..So be aware of dust with this model as the lens can suck it into the body..With that said its still a good buy just be aware of the dust problem and protect it from dust.

Reviews.Title: Avoid This Camera
Reviews.Author: Barry D. Elfant
Reviews.Content: My camera is inoperable after 300 photos over a two year period. The lens is stuck in the extended position and there is a "focus error" on the screen.I bought this unit in December of 2011 so it is out of warranty. I called Panasonic and asked for their help in fixing the problem. A techie said it would cost $180 plus to fix. This is more than I paid for the product when it was new. I called customer service and mentioned to them that this is a problem faced by a significant amount of customers with this camrera model. I was assured that I would be assisted by a reduction of repair costs if I sent in my original receipt. I then received a prompt off-the-wall response that my camera was out of warranty and the camera they received from me would only be fixed if I pay for it. I never sent them my camera and the spelling and grammar were incorrect in their response.I will never, never buy a Panasonic product again. There camera was defective and their customer service was horrible.

Reviews.Title: good for 6 months and then it dies !
Reviews.Author: Scott S. Wesley
Reviews.Content: camera worked good for a while. but then the zoom lense started to act up. now its stuck and it doesn't work at all. only 6 months old ! very upset !

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: kaccat
Reviews.Content: We bought this last fall for our trip to Europe that we just took this month.  It was so easy to pull it out of my pocket, turn it on and shoot.  You don't have to try to focus or anything.  It easily zooms also.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZS9 14.1MP Digital Camera with 16x Optical Zoom and 21x Intelligent Zoom Function
Reviews.Author: Gift Card
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced, pictures come out god quality, happy with purchase. Would estimate pictures quality for this camera to be at least $ 180 - 220 when it was only $ 130 when I purchased.

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera
Reviews.Author: David Chen
Reviews.Content: Compact and versatile camera considering the price.  I usually took this camera with me when I travel and for that this is great camera.  For better picture quality, you have to go for DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with DMC-ZS9
Reviews.Author: DC Baird
Reviews.Content: I recently replaced a Panasonic DMC-ZS8 with a DMC-ZS9.  I couldn't be more pleased.  On a recent trip to Damon Point near Ocean Shores, I was able to get amazing photos of the visiting Snowy Owls.

Reviews.Title: GREAT COMPACT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: M. Devaney "IrishMoe"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good photos.  I have taken indoor photos in low light, outdoor photos in bright sun and cloudy days and all the photos turn out so clear and it is also very fast at taking the photos.  Some cameras have a delay in taking the photo but not this one.  It is also so small it fits in almost every pocket.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: great point and shoot camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Jalasmile
Reviews.Content: my cannon camera broke right after Christmas of 2011 so I really hated that I had missed all the good deals from black friday and all the Christmas specials on the digital cameras, I started shopping online for a better camera than I previously had and I loved the fact that this carera had 16X optical zoom plus the added bonus is it has an Intelligent zoom feature which allows about 5x more added zoom 14.1 megapixs, I was about to purchase this camera from Best Buy but Amazon had an amazing deal that I just couldn't pass up, it was a very good price $129.99 plus free shipping, it also comes with a photo fun shooting download which is kinda cool to play around with!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Deb
Reviews.Content: Good value for little money - good product and we are very pleased - sorry it did not come with a memory card but for the price could not complain

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: yj
Reviews.Content: This is a great product for the money.  It doesn't use reg batteries so I would sugget buying a backup battery and a case also from amazon also when you purchase.  It has a great zooming ability and is very user friendly.  Very impressed with product.

Reviews.Title: Lumix Zs9 is a great, easy to use camera.
Reviews.Author: HGH
Reviews.Content: I have owned many digital cameras and among them Lumix Tz3 and Fz3. An avid traveler, I am taking the Lumix Zs9 and Canon G12 own my next cruise. The Zs9 is for long telephoto shots and video. For the price, the Zs 9 can not be beat.Canon G12 10 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.8 Inch Vari-Angle LCD1/11/12 Visited Las Vegas and took pictures and movies of the Hoover Dam from the new Tillman Bridge. The pics and movies (zooming in and out) were outstanding like the more expensive Canon SX-10 which is much heavier. Instead of using automatic, try A and S settings. Takes great low-light pics.

Reviews.Title: Another Lumix Winner
Reviews.Author: Phil King
Reviews.Content: This is my third Lumix camera. Again, it surprises me with its abilities. The lens with 16X (optical, 21 intelligent) zooms for amazing close ups. The 14.1 mega pixels produces a picture able to be greatly enlarged. I use my cameras for color magazine articles and get rave reviews on my photos. The Leica lens lives up to the legends of the German predicessors. My only complaint is that the magnification will require at least a monopod to stabilize that power for large enlargements. However, at 10X or 12X, in good light, very little camera shake can be detected. The colors that this camera produce are also superb.

Reviews.Title: Lumix
Reviews.Author: Allan Hawkins V
Reviews.Content: Well, after 4 months of continuos work with this little monster, I finally got the dust inside the lens! Amazing to know that Lumix is doing almost nothing to fix this?

Reviews.Title: How Disappointing
Reviews.Author: victor flaming
Reviews.Content: When I saw this new version come available, I was very excited.  A 16-x zoom lens 14.1 Mega Pixel chip, what an upgrade from my favorite DMC-TZ5 9MP 10x zoom lens, which I have enjoyed for a couple years and a clear upgrade from my older Panasonic camera.  It's first use was at a wedding to capture important moments with the expectation that I could edit the file by cropping out what was not important and get closer to the subject of interest.  What a disappointment, the picture quality was very poor, moving objects were blurred "bride walking down the aisle" poor depth of field, grainy spotty pictures, need I go on.I decided to compare the two cameras with the expectation that my old 9MP would show lower detail and poorer light levels.  My old DMC-TZ5 out preformed the new DMC-ZS9 in all areas except the power of the zoom.  That includes video quality, focus, and sound.  What happened? Panasonic has been offering clear quality upgrades over the years; how do you go from a 9MP to a 14MP and get clearly poorer results?  I suggest you shop around and look online for product reviews comparing this one to other cameras at a similar cost.  Although if you are just looking for a point and shoot, and only expect to print out 4x6 photos and shoot mainly outside, the zoom is incredible and this camera may be the one for you.  P.S. notice how many are available used and the price drop, that should have been my first clue.

Reviews.Title: thrilled with Amazon and its products
Reviews.Author: goodwitch2
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something more than just a cookie cutter point and shoot.  This camera gives me the option of point and shoot or choosing my own options for a composition.  I still have a lot to learn, but I am thrilled about my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: This Camera got all what you need and more , except if you are a proffesional and work in photography. Well built, high Quality exterior casing, I felt its as good as the canon sx 200 is , but it has better options and you can, with Lumix, zoom while recording a movie, Canon you cannot, it goes out of focus.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: D. Glaze
Reviews.Content: Makes a great small camera when you always want one available. Perfect for pocket or purse. Takes great photos. Simple to use.

Reviews.Title: not quite
Reviews.Author: B. Florence
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera, but it didn't quite deliver; my primary disappointment is the quality of the jpeg files. a few of them seemed to be fine, but most of them turned out to appear overprocessed with smudgy details (using 100% previews). I you don't scrutinize such details, you might not notice this; I tried not to be overly concerned with the quality of jpegs from a point and shoot, but I couldn't help it. I'll probably go back to a canon since I was pretty satisfied with my old S3 IS a while back.

Reviews.Title: Video and sound quality is Amazing?
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera because my fiancee was going to get one for christmas. He plays music and is tyhe lead singer in a local band, I have used it already to take video of him playing and the quality is awesome. He plays loud music and the sound isn't drounded out like a cell phone would take. The only thing is, I still haven't figured out if I could use the flash for a light for the video yet. I just need to take the time to read the owners manual, which I don't need to for most things because this camera is so easy to use. The auto setting itself is flawless it quickly locks onto your subject and uses the macro efficiently. I don't know a whole lot about what this camera is capable of doing, I just know I love the pictures it takes.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good
Reviews.Author: Harry Sett Vizcaino
Reviews.Content: I'm very satisfied with this product. Good price, good photos,consider weight and seems to be a good semiprofessional option. I recommend this product for purchase.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: arturo
Reviews.Content: it is the most amazing zoom on a regular digital camera it is worth the price does not come with a sd cardbut has built in memory video quality is good 720p good camera

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMZ- ZS9
Reviews.Author: James Longo
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot camera love the zoom very easy to use and the pictures are very good plus it takes video and the sound is in stero. Panasonic did a great job with this camera and if you want a camera that you can take anywere at a great price from Amazon buy it and you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: Oops, Blind In The Dark
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Amazon in December 2011 when my trusty 7 megapixel Canon Powershot A550 developed a lens error after four and a half years of service. I read the mostly positive reviews and didn't pay much heed to those who complained that it didn't perform well in the dark.First, the Pros:The camera has a solid feel to it and the  body contains  enough metal  to reassure you that it is going to last for some time.  The controls are intuitive and the attention to detail is good down to the way the battery cover springs open and the latching mechanism within the battery compartment feels secure. The zoom lens operates fairly quietly, more so than the Canon and image quality is good.  I was able to take some photos in shutter priority mode of a circus act from 100 feet away with very good results in imperfect lighting conditions (night) so the zoom and exposure control capabilities are quite impressive. Battery life is also quite good.Now the consI was attempting to take some pictures of my wife at a night event. This was something that the old Canon handled flawlessly in the past without any difficulty. It took great night photos even when lighting was poor and approaching complete darkness; the illuminator would  provide sufficient light to frame the subject properly. After boasting to my wife about how wise my choice of new camera had been I was utterly embarrassed that I couldn't even see her in the LCD display. Many of the shots had to be taken by guesswork which was totally frustrating and the results were even more disappointing because I simply could not zoom in or out properly to frame the shot. The majority of the photos missed most of her body and others were not centred or zoomed in too much or too little.I will be checking to see if one of the camera's modes allows for better night time illumination, but it shouldn't have to be so difficult to find if it is there at all.Bottom LineGreat camera for good lighting conditions but forget it if you want to do portraits in darkness. Panasonic's engineers should try out some Canon cameras for night time performance to see what the competition is offering. Because of this flaw I will have to look for another camera with good overall performance. You can rest assured that it won't be a Panasonic this time.

Reviews.Title: False AVCHD advertising
Reviews.Author: Amicus Curia "pinbalwyz"
Reviews.Content: Got it yesterday with some anticipation after taking a long time for delivery. This model was produced exclusively for Amazon sales and the asking price seemed too good to be true--it was!This model is very much like my Lumix ZS5 except with a longer zoom and stereo microphone. It's virtually identical to the ZS8 but for the latter's monaural microphone. NONE of these cameras comes with Panasonics AVCHD (lite) video compression. They come with Quick Time (QT) video compression instead. Reportedly the ZS7 came with AVCHD as did the ZS3. This has some profound downsides as I'll explain below. I also noticed the ZS5 though with a shorter zoom, had a larger diameter lense. Maybe it's the optical physics kicking up a fuss but my understanding is a larger lens is likely to have more light gathering capability.All of these models are limited to creating file sizes of 2GB or less. So is my Sony video recorder. The difference is the Sony doesn't simply STOP when it reaches the 2GB limit, it proceeds to create a successor 2GB file and keeps filming. The Panasonic, at least the ZS5, ZS8, & ZS9 do not. They stop dead in their tracks. To make matters worse, the QT jpeg format, though widely understood and compatible, is a poor video compression scheme consisting of essentially a stack of jpeg photos per second. The AVCHD compression algorithm developed in tandem with Sony pays off by squeezing more information into that 2GB file. PLUS, you'll recall, the Panasonic stops dead in its tracks when it reaches the 2GB limit rather than continuing with a subsequent 2GB file. The Sony does this without a hiccup. I'm not certain whether the Lumix models that *do* include the AVCHD standard will continue to tape provided storage room remains or not. Now for the biggest piece of bad news--without a more efficient compression algorithm storing information in that 2GB file, your maximum film length with the ZS5, the ZS8, & the ZS9 will be around 8 minutes--period! You'll have to be physically present to depress the start/shutter button again to continue shooting. This does little for continuity in public events like, say a speaker or a lecture. Perhaps this camera is better suited for 'B' roll than providing a continuous flow.What's sad is all of the 2GB file limit DEAD STOP and the AVCHD could be resolved with a firmware upgrade...fat chance. Panasonic's got your money so now you can crawl into a hole AND DIE so far as the company is concerned. This arrangement was so thoughtless in avoiding attention to detail and ergonomics.On the up side, the camera is highly portable, produces reasonably respectable IQ for its size, has CCD technology better implemented than Panasonic's ZS10 CMOS camera. There are plenty of fun features including a plethora of scene modes, a menu system that's easy enough to learn but a weak internal flash. To its credit, the autofocus works well in video mode and the IA (intelligent) mode is reasonably effective. There are also a host of manual options which makes the unit attractive to a wide spectrum of consumers. For travel and taking snaps, it's ideal...and it won't bankrupt you.Somebody needs to jail break this camera by hacking the firmware to provide AVCHD and sequential 2GB file creation. 8 minutes just ain't long enough--even for porn producers. Didn't the Rodney King beating last longer than that? Weddings?--well, given the current average length of matrimony...maybe!
